data.formatted_address: 350 Đ. Nguyễn Văn Cừ, An Thới, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Phu Quoc Prison History Museum

reviews.text:
It could be so much better.
Pros > free entry (you can make a donation at the altar), free parking. Historic site which provides further evidence of man's inhumanity. Bilingual Vietnamese/English signage and story boards.
Cons > the upkeep of the place is poor, rubbish and empty beer cans strewn around. Given the nature of the place one would expect visitors to show a bit of respect. The administrators of the site should spend some time and money, if only out of respect for those that suffered at this site.
Either keep up the condition in a way that respects the history and the souls who suffered here or close it.
As it is now, it serves as more of a half forgotten testament an uncaring administration than to the human suffering endured here.
Weird > at the end of the self guided site tour visitors are greeted by a gift shop selling pearl jewellery. Very incongruous.

If you like history and free entertainment, this is the place for you.  It is free to get into and walk around.  It seems like not many of the original structures are still standing but the thousands of meters of barbed wire that make up the complex are.  Self guided tour with posted signs are available for your own please to read.  If you like history, this is a must see.

I've been to Phu quoc many times but first time to come here. Just like the reviews, its sad and I cannot imagine the life during those years. Free entrance, yeah not much to see but the story was there. Really worth a visit.

A quick history of vietnams dark time.  It’s free to visit and overall a quick tour. There are English and Vietnamese signs to explain what’s going on.   You can even see how small the escape tunnels were.  I would say this is a must see at least once to understand the history of the prison.

The place is free of charge. I have visited it on my way to the Sunset town. Quite small, but worth of a trip, as it is history and when travelling, you want to learn more about places you visit.  All figures look quite real and the realistic reflection of tortures leave quite sad feeling.

data.formatted_address: Khu phố 2, Tp. Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 92500, Vietnam
data.name: Dinh Cau temple

reviews.text:
At about 12:45pm, we headed out to explore Duong Dong Town. By walking along the path next to Seashells Phu Quoc, we arrived at the harbour next to the Seaside Shrine and Lighthouse (Dinh Cau). The colourful steps by the harbour makes for some instagrammable shots. Walking along the streets of Duong Dong Town, we saw local coffee joints, seafood restaurants and also the street where the night market was located…

For more details, visit 2bearbear today!

A nice pagoda and lighthouse complex hewn out of some rocks on the shore, it affords nice views of the sea, especially at sunset (or sunrise, if you rise early). It is just a short distance from the night market and most of the budget hotel options. It seems to be a hangout for the locals (kids playing, some street food, couples strolling, etc.) which adds to the atmosphere. Nothing truly spectacular but part of the Phu Quoc experience.

Pro Tip: When entering the actual worship area, please remove shoes and do not step on the doorway. Dress code seems to be relaxed here in keeping with the beachside location
Dinh cau temple is very small temple but it was worth to visit there. Beautiful sunset and locals are swiming in the sunset , near night market

It's a small temple by the ocean and a famous place for tourists to visit, check in and take pictures. The view to the ocean is beautiful. I was there twice but on rain season so I didn't have a chance to see the sunset. The temple is always full of people, some of them climb to the rocks to take pictures. The road to the ocean is gorgeous, you can feel ocean all around you.
A very spiritual place. You can feel inner peace here. Please remove the shoes before entering the temple.

data.formatted_address: Phú Quốc, Phu Quoc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Phú Quốc

reviews.text: We went in off season. Empty and Rainy, nice restruants didn’t go to the beach but our hotel was really nice. Everyone friendly and welcoming. We would recommend going at different time of year

Just came back from Phu Quoc. Loved the beaches, food, massage, service. Water was very clear (we stayed at Green Bay Resort), small coral reef near our hotel. Some places on island are unkempt with trash, but some are incredibly clean and pleasant to visit. Read local guides and reviews for best experience. Definitely coming back there again

We loved Phu Quoc we spent a week on the island. We hired a scooter to use while we stayed $6 a day but gave it back after 3 days because we discovered the free green electric buses fantastic very modern with AC. The buses took you to most of the attractions, and if you fancied eating out in a different island location, you hoped on a free bus it was great!
Definitely go to Phu Quoc. we stayed in Phu Quoc Town, its busy, but you get used to it. The beaches are lovely

Phu Quoc is a popular tourist destination it looks like, but everywhere you go, except if it's a big hotel or establishment, thrash / rubbish is everywhere (like Saigon and Binh Thuan and Mui Ne).

Streets also reek of spoiled food/ sewer especially in places where street food is sold. (Pop up food stalls, you'll easily recognize them with carts and glass storage and food diplay).

Their oceans are also surrounded with rubbish and there really isnt so much sand :( , unlike the Philippines.

I stayed in a 5 star hotel M Hotel (is amazing and is a sustainability ally!) and the service was great but also explored local eateries (low-end food cafeterias), food is great wherever you go.

Some people are friendly, and they really cant sleak english.  I experienced incorrect orders given to me (which are happy accidents because the food turned out great anyways), because I asked about certain foodm so if uou want something, just point it out 😁

There are no heavy traffic at all, weather is really hot in Mid March, but yeah, it's cheaper here. Not always, but many times, you'll encounter sellers overcharging you ;)

Phu Quoc, like Saigon, is also colorful but less busier on the streets.

Grab bike and car are also available here but not as many like in HCM City.

#disappointed #stink

Phu Quoc Island boasts idyllic beaches, romantic sunsets, evergreen forests, and a serene atmosphere, making it an ideal holiday destination for travellers looking to escape bustling city life. Located 45 kilometres west of Ha Tien in the far south of Vietnam, the northern part of the island is relatively untouched due to its status as a UNESCO-listed national park but there are plenty of luxurious resorts, funky bars, and quaint cafes along the southern coastline. Aside from beachside activities, visitors can also explore traditional villages, expansive nature parks and Buddhist pagodas, all of which are easily accessible via motorcycle, taxi, bus or even day trips by reputable companies. Catering to just about any budget level and preference, Phu Quoc’s dining scene ranges from local markets selling fresh seafood and Vietnamese street food to expat-owned bistros offering authentic western and European fare.

The best attractions in Phu Quoc prove that there are plenty of things to do during your tropical vacation besides relaxing on its pristine beaches. Situated 45 kilometres west of Ha Tien, Phu Quoc Island is home to unique Cao Dai and Buddhist temples, vibrant markets, traditional fishing villages, and pepper plantations – perfect for travellers looking to experience the local lifestyle. Despite the growing number of tourist accommodations and modern facilities along its expansive coastline, more than half of this tropical island is still a UNESCO-listed national park, where you can enjoy a full day of spotting rare wildlife species, hiking, camping, photography and bird-watching. Read on for our list of the most popular things to do on Phu Quoc Island.

Phu Quoc National Park comprises more than half of Phu Quoc Island’s northern region, where adventurous travellers can enjoy a range of outdoor pursuits throughout their tropical vacation. Declared a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve in 2010, this massive natural attraction spans over 314, 000 square metres of unique flora and fauna, evergreen forests, and dense mountain ranges. While the majority of Phu Quoc National Park is strictly protected by the Vietnamese government for research purposes, visitors can make their way to the Khu Rung Nguyen Sinh Forest Reserve via Ganh Dau Village as it’s accessible for camping, hiking, bird-watching, and photography. Nature lovers can also spot rare wildlife such as long-tailed macaques, silver langurs, slow lories, otters, and hornbills.

If you’re looking to test out your endurance, Mount Heaven in Phu Quoc National Park is accessible within a challenging four-hour trek through the evergreen forest followed by a 10-metre-tall bamboo ladder. The highest peak in the national park is Mount Chua, which stands 600 metres above sea level, but hiking trails and viewing platforms for the mountain are currently under construction.   Located 26 kilometres north of Duong Dong, the best way to get to Phu Quoc National Park is by booking a day tour or renting a motorcycle. The roads leading towards Ganh Dau Village can be rather bumpy, so only opt for the latter if you’re comfortable navigating through dirt roads.

data.formatted_address: 22V9+P59, ĐT46, An Thới, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Phu Quoc Prison Martyrs' Monument

reviews.text: Museum showing the torture of north Vietnamese during the civil war.  Lots of re enactment display and signs in English and Vietnamese to understand what is happening.  I would say it’s a good visit at least once.  Also is free to visit

Free parking and entrance. You can find information in English attached here and there about what happened in this prison. Escape road is pretty impressive. They sell drink in exit because you will need it especially after visiting those metal structures.

Impressive monument. On a closer observation you could find many hollow figures in the huge centre block with chains on the wrists. It symbolises imprisonment and carnage of Vietnamese! The prison is just opposite this monument.
If you're going to the prison you should stop off here to appreciate the impressive design of the monument.
It's free to go in and it's sad, scary what happened there and worth the effort to really know what POWs had to endure from the American puppet government during the war.

data.formatted_address: 149 Đường Trần Hưng Đạo, Khu phố 7, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 92500, Vietnam
data.name: Coi Nguon Museum

reviews.text:
Great experience, a mish-mash of everything but fun to see. More explanations in English would be great, as interesting as the exhibits were it was hard to know what we were seeing... what were the bones from? Why were the pots and plates of interest, how old were they and where did they come from, etc.
Support this museum if you get here, you can see that funds are desperately needed for repairs to this amazing building and to assist staffing that would result in cleaner exhibit cases. 50,000 dong is really cheap for this experience. Well done to the curators!

This museum is half empty and in a bad shape. The museum itself should be in a museum. Most things are only described in Vietnamese, and the ones where English is addes are rather poorly translated. Half of the things you can't even see because the glass cabinets are dusty and fogged. Walls and ceilings are leaking water. Some rooms smell. It's 50k VND per person for entry but it's a waste of money. True, the entrance gate and the general image of the building is nice and tempting, but the insides are not - unfortumately.

A beautiful building. My ticket was 50k. Not a soul in the museum))) Seems that last time it was updated was when it was built. But there is definitely certain charm in walking in an empty museum. There's a terrace with a view on one of the top floors. And you can learn about island's history from the posters on the walls.
If you want to know anout Phu Quoc, dont hesitate to come here. This museum have everything you need to know from the very beginning of Phu Quoc and how Vietnam government develops them.
Dusty, low maintenence and dark. We're only visitors. Would badly need some renovation. Nice views though from the upper floors.

reviews.text:
A Fantastic Day at Vin Wonders Theme Park!

We visited Vin Wonders Theme Park in July and had an amazing time! The park was surprisingly quiet, with no lineups, which meant our kids got to enjoy every ride without any waiting. They had an absolute blast!

The park was well-maintained, and the staff were friendly and helpful. We appreciated the variety of attractions and shows, which catered to all ages. The kids loved the roller coasters, water rides, and interactive exhibits.

We highly recommend Vin Wonders Theme Park to families looking for a fun and stress-free day out. The lack of crowds in July made our visit even more enjoyable. Don't hesitate to plan your trip – you won't regret it!

Tips:

- Visit in July for smaller crowds
- Arrive early to make the most of your day
- Take advantage of the variety of rides and shows
- Enjoy the park's themed areas and decorations

A great way to spend the day. This Disneyland inspired amusement park has everything - water rides, roller coasters, an aquarium and more.

The commute inside the place is rather smooth with shuttles, the rides are good too. Zeus’ Revenge was rather aggressive, short ride but all sorts of roller coaster elements added.

Most fun we had was at the shooting range. It’s a hoot.

Definitely worth a visit.

Amazing place for having fun and being entertained. So many things to do and rides from water, climbing, roller coasters, this place has everything. I loved the aquarium that was here as well. I will guarantee you will not be able to do everything in your first visit or get bored with what they have.

A place that is highly recommended if you are family with kids..

I didn't visit the water park but there are plenty of activities to play from morning till evening last show.

And regarding the last show, it is a must. Do not skip it. Be there by 6pm and get a nice spot at the center. Started sharp 6.45pm

Mixed thoughts about this theme park. It’s marketed as a very large kids theme park and I think it has a lot of potential but the day we went it was a real disappointment. It was 35degree hot 75-80% humidity so it was definitely uncomfortable but that shouldn’t justify why 80% of the attractions shows and rides were closed and now even manned by operators. It was like walking through a dead theme park in some areas. Only the aquarium and waterpark were really popular areas. The kids attractions did have a lot of realistic and cute props but it was just depressing that nothing was operating or open. Advertising to customers about packages but then not warning them so many things would be closed is quite misleading. Even if everything was open, note this is not a theme park for young kids if you want them to go on rides minimum height for literally 90% of the rides is 1m.

data.formatted_address: Bãi Đất Đỏ, Tổ 10 Khu Phố 5, Bãi Nam, Tp. Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Sunworld Hon Thom Phu Quoc

reviews.text:
The cable car is worth it, the views are gorgeous. However that's about the only positive. The destination is a half finished not really open kinda theme park, food options very limited and it just has no soul.

Jump on the cable car, maybe get a drink and go straight back.

Cable car doesn't run between 11.30 and 1.30, so make sure you time it right or you are stuck there with bad food for 2 hours.

The ride over on the cable car is almost worth the price of admission! But for water lovers the park is terrific. Many choices of water attractions, and except for the wooden roller coaster, there is not much there for adventure seekers. However, the beach area is very serene and of course the beaches themselves are pristine.

I have to say it’s worth every penny. Just come here early and spend the whole day at the beach. The restaurant called “Local Market” here is actually very cheap and very good, so you don’t need a buffet combo ticket. Everything is included in the cable car tickets, and that’s a fantastic value.

The cable car ride over was great.

The park is very new and the gardens are absolutely beautiful and so well maintained.

The only disappointment for us was the fact that we couldn't go on 50% of the waterslides as I had a small metal clasp on the back of my bather top and my husband had a tiny stud on his back pocket of his swim shorts that was leas than the size of a pea.

They physically inspect you prior to each ride only after you have walked all the way to the top and then reject you as they don't accept any metal on your swin costume.

There are no signs anywhere stating this, so we were a bit annoyed.
You should take the cablecar if you go to sunworld waterpark. including waterpark admission in cablecar fare, you can be entering for free. As well as enjoy waterpark, you can go to beautiful beach

Visited with family on a weekday, there were few people. A very large area, a lot of entertainment, very clean, many places where you can have a quick snack and a full meal. I would like to note the work of the staff, they are very responsible about their work, they constantly ask if any help is needed, they are always ready to help. reviews.text:
It’s an interesting place, a good way perhaps to spend an evening. The main show is very, very overrated, but the place itself is decent. The food isn’t that great, most restaurants serve similar food. We tried three different places and got almost the same food.

The boat ride is nice though, the rest - nothing to write home about.

looks like Venice with water taxi. Beautiful small apartments to rent but some of the property are not property labelled..

One says beach house but actual property is named lala home stay which is very difficult and misleading to tourist.

shops are a bit expensive therefore better buy your groceries before flying to phu quoc.

The idea to build an entertainment center with shops and restaurants is fine. Unfortunately most of the venues are still empty waiting for operation.
There are some solid restaurants, though. One can choose from different levels from street food to a la carte seafood. Minimarkets open 24/7 (basic grocery) can be found too.
The daily half hour "Venice" night show is excellent, featuring gondolas, fireworks, laser animation, music and dancers. Really worth to wait til 9:30pm start.
Wow! Grandworld must be seen to be believed! Such a fantasy world, very beautiful with so many things to see and do. Especially loved the old village and night show, amazing!

A cool place to take photos and take a walk along the river. The boat ride is a must especially during sunset. Nice pictures can be taken. Small playground at the entrance of Grandworld for the kids. This place has surpassed my expectations. Hope to visit the theme park one day.

reviews.text:
Warning warning warning ⚠️
We got trapped on the island against our will for 3 + hours.

As it was raining all week we decided to take the cable car on the 8 km round journey.
We bought tickets and boarded the cable car around 1:50pm
Traveled the 4 km to the water park island with the intention to stay on the cable car for the return journey. It was to our surprise we were told we had to exit the cable car at the  halfway mark as it stopped running at 2:00.pm We were forced to stay on the island in torrential rain for another hour and a half.
Unfortunately at 3:30pm when we went to line up to get back on the cable car 500+ other people decided to leave at the same time. I imagine because of the rain.
The complete chaos and lack of respect from selfish people  pushing and shoving trying to get to the front of the queue was too much to bear for people like us who don't like big tight pushing crowds.
It took us nearly 2 hours to get back on a cable car to get back home.
If you only want to do a return trip on the cable car ensure you have enough time to get to the island and back before one of the three, hour and a half long stoppages throughout the day. For a trip that was going to bring us back to the beginning by 2:15pm, it ended up getting us back just before 6:00pm.
Unfortunately being a very wet rainy day likely increases the crowds tenfold wanting to come back at 3:30. The water park may be fantastic and the cable car is amazing.
But there is no warning we would go halfway and be told we needed to wait another few hours before we could return.
The cable car itself is excellent, the island and amenities fantastic.
Getting trapped on an island in torrential rain against your will was not something we expected or agreed on.

I was truly surprised by the cable car. I was not the type of travellers that liked man made tourist attractions, but the cable car surprised me. The views were absolutely breathtaking, and it was genuinely a nice ride there, and the waterpark is included so we actually had something to do while we waited for the cable car back.

The water park is suitable for all ages and all levels of thrill seekers. Go. You won't be disappointed.

It's worth it just to experience the cable cart ride. However, the ticket includes the Aquatopia entry, which, as a young adult , is enjoyable. It is best to bring aqua shoes so that you don't have to remove footwear for the slides as the footpaths become very hot throughout the day!

The cable car is great, the views are amazing. The cars are spacious and airy.

The location you get to is pretty much a half finished theme park with a waterpark. I pretty much just turned around and took the return journey back.

The cars don't run between 11.30 and 1.30, so be aware if you take an 11.30 car you're stuck in a weird half empty park for 2 hours!

The departure location is a strange, devoid of any soul fake town. Worth a walk around just to experience it!

Depends on the weather the cable car right could be really good or really bad. It could be stop because of bad weather and it will not worth the money in the raining. You could buy the ticket right at the station or online 20 minutes Cable Car ride to PineApple Island, where are you can go for the waterpark or the beach or roller coaster eagle eye is watching viewing tower or lunch. 650,000 VND for 2 way cable car ticket. It will run by their schedule, so remember the time, and when everyone all want to go back, eat will be really crowded in the cabin. 30 people in 1 cabin, so be aware of the go back time, shouldn’t go at 3:30pm

reviews.text:
We did the cooking class with Phuong as one of our Honeymoon activities. We enjoyed every bit of it! From shopping for ingredients early at the wet market, to cooking at her garden full with coconut trees, and then enjoying the delicious food we cooked while playing with her lovely dog.

We learnt more about the Vietnam culture in this cooking class than anywhere else. Puong was like a long-lost friend who can talk to you about any topics. She also studied tourism so she know exactly how to take picture for us at the market. We truly enjoyed our time with her and would high recommend this course to anyone, regardless of your cooking level, because you will learn much more than just cooking!

We had a fantastic time with Phuong from Green Hat Holiday whilst visiting Phu Quoc this week.

During the “Discovery of the North” tour we visited a pepper farm, took in a temple via kayak on the Cua Cun river, had a fantastically tasty, typically Vietnamese, fresh seafood lunch in a Floating village restaurant (which we would never have found ourselves!) and called in at a wonderfully tranquil bee farm.

Phuong was informative, outgoing and fun throughout.
She was also very quick to respond to all enquiries/emails when booking online in the days before, and kept us “in the loop” at all times.

We would highly recommend a tour with Green Hat Holiday - you will have a brilliant day out seeing parts of the island that you would likely otherwise be completely unaware of!

We did the private snorkelling tour & by far the best snorkelling tour that I have been on. It was a pleasure to meet the lovely Phuong who was our tour guide.

The trip started at an island of Phu Quoc where we did snorkelling before going to another spot for some more snorkelling.

Phuong knew the area well & we saw some amazing coral reefs & schools of fish. It was truly beautiful.

I would recommend taking the food option along with the trip as that includes a superb freshly made barbecue seafood, seafood fried rice, fried fish & tropical fruits.

For lunch we went to a beach where Phuong & Mr. Day barbecued the seafood & we had a great time sharing stories & food with them.

A special mention to Mr. Day, our speed boat driver who was always around to ensure we were in a safe environment.

My 8 year old son was not that interested in the snorkelling after the second island & we were quite happy to leave him with Mr.Day on the boat who looked after him.

After lunch we went to another island for snorkelling which was beautiful & had a lot of sea urchins.

All in all it was a day well spent. I felt that I had gone with friends rather than a tour all thanks to the wonderful hospitality shown by Phuong.

I am happy to recommend this tour to all.

I had a private tour around South Island with Phuong. She is an energetic, friendly and helpful tour guide. I was impressed by her enthusiasm. It was a great memory. I would be back to Phu Quoc to do the North Island tour again, and Phuong will be my tour guide definitely.

This tour offers a multi dimensional view of life in Viet Nam that few of us get to experience!

Our guide was the real deal, sharing her experience of growing up Indochina and how that differs to most of our lives.

I am honest in saying the tour took us outside our comfort zone and to places we never though we would find ourselves.

Such is the instant trust and admiration we have for our guide!

Our sincere thanks to our guide Phương for allowing us into her life & culture.

Don’t miss this tour, and make sure you are hungry!

data.formatted_address: 22H4+XVH, An Thoi, Phú Quốc, Kien Giang 92513, Vietnam
data.name: Sunset Town

reviews.text:
Let me tell you, Sunset Town in Phu Quoc is unlike anything I've ever experienced.  It's not just a place to stay, it's a whole vibe.  They really nailed the name - Sunset Town.  Everywhere you turn, you have this incredible view of the sun setting over the ocean.  It's like living in a postcard.

I stayed in one of the high-rise apartments, and let me tell you, the view from the balcony was incredible.  Golden light washing over the water, sailboats silhouetted against the horizon.  Pure magic every night.  But Sunset Town isn't all about sunsets (although, they are pretty spectacular).  There's this amazing energy to the place.  Live music spilling out of cafes, people strolling along the cobblestone streets.  It felt chic and romantic, but also friendly and welcoming.

I spent hours just wandering around, taking in the architecture.  It's supposed to be reminiscent of the Mediterranean, and they did a fantastic job.  Colorful buildings, winding alleys, little piazzas with fountains.  It felt like I'd been transported to another world entirely.

Now, it's not the cheapest place to stay, but hey, you get what you pay for.  And for the experience, the view, and the overall feeling of being somewhere special, I'd say it's worth every penny.  If you're looking for a romantic getaway or a place to splurge on yourself, Sunset Town is the place to do it.

Vietnam's Italian city modeled on the Italian architecture of the Amalfi Coast. Tourist spot and starting point for some attractions / activities in the area. Nice to look at and quirky scenery in the Vietnamese countryside. There are restaurants and bars but unfortunately by 7:30pm most of them were empty and there were only a few people left on the street.
My impression is that this is a deserted and quiet town in the evening, which is not at all in keeping with the Italian model.

Mixed feelings about this place... It is a weird ghost town like many others in Phu Quoc. It has some kind of charm due to its prime location, but it is still creepy and feels dead. Someone sunk a lot of money into building the city and they still keep it nice and tidy.

The way it stands right now it is more a tourist attraction than a city.

Stunningly beautiful area! There are nice cafès and restaurants, lovely and friendly people as everywhere in Vietnam, and an incredible view from everywhere you are. Way less crowded than the counterparts in Italy and less expensive as well.
Some buildings are still empty, but this will certainly be a busy area in the future. Highly recommended.

This place both facinates me and makes me very angry. While it is a very stunning and they did a good job replicating the Italian architecture, it's also a testament to corporate greed at the highest level. 90% of the buildings are completely empty the rest a mix of hotels and coffee shops. Yes it is pretty and picturesque, but there is no heart.

data.formatted_address: 9RCQ+FGC, Tổ 1, Tp. Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: PhuQuocSupClub @ ALOHA88 Ganh Dau

reviews.text:
It was wonderful! Phat speaks perfect English as he used to live in Canada and found his way back to his roots in Vietnam. He prepared us well before our kayak trip to the coral beach and we were super happy with what we saw under water snorkeling. Totally recommend this for everyone who wants go just get around the island with a kayak and combine it with a snorkeling experience. We did it on our own to have more flexibility but phat also offers tours in groups which is cheaper than going by yourself.

Note that if you chose to Paddle to the coral beach spot a little southbound, there are two beaches. The first beach was a better snorkeling spot as the water was cleaner and there was more fish and a more colourful flora and fauna under water than on the second beach one bay further away.

Made the trip up with friends to kayak as we read many great reviews of visiting the nearby islets to snorkel at. Sadly, the waters were too rough for beginners to kayak there today. Nevertheless, Phat recommended that we try paddle boarding, and we had so much fun even though it was just within the cove learning from him and his daughter. After we were done in the water, we also caught the beautiful sunset before ending the day. Definitely a must-visit experience when you’re in Phu Quoc.

A great view, beach and kayak, sup place. The owner, Roger, is so active, friendly and share a lot of things about water sport, local life and invited us a special water coconut and peanut, fresh milk. Highly recommend for a sunset time and water sport here

At Aloha88 we've rent a kayak to sail to an awesome snorkelspot a bit down south.

The host - Phat - is a great guy, speaks perfect english, and knows a lot about the area.

After a short kayak trip (15 minutes) to the snorkelspot, we dragged the kayak on the sand beach and went in the water for a good swim and snorkel.

We saw a lot of fish, many different species, and even some green coral here and there.

Because it was so great, we came here two times - the first time late afternoon (17 - 18 hr), it was good but the sea is less calm and the sun is low so the sight is a bit less than in the morning.
The second time we went from 9 to 11 in the morning, which was perfect. Calm sea, great sight - and the sun not yet as hot as around midday and later.

In the morning you will not be the only one, there are excursions to this particular place. In the afternoon it is way more quiet, but as said - less light under water.

We went with another couple, experienced (a bit spoiled ;-)) divers - and they too were enthusiastic about the trip.

We definitely recommend to go snorkeling at this spot, preferably  by kayak on your own musclepower, instead of joining a group trip on a motorized boat.

One note: If you - while in the water - have to stand up for some reason, try not to stand on the coral. Instead try to find a sandy spot or a rock.

Mr. Phat and his daughter helped me to recover my drone from the sea which was sunk for 15 hours.
Unfortunately drone won’t work but the all the data was recovered.
Special thanks to him and his daughter for this search operation, i was really glad and surprised when they refused to take money or gifts as a token for helping me.

I do highly recommend this place for snorkelling, kayaking and other water sports activities.
This place is run by a very cute wonderful family.

Thank you Mr. Phat

reviews.text: Beautiful beach and amazing sunset but full of trash like many beaches in Vietnam unfortunately. Accessible by searching for the “family inn” on google map, go straight by it (the owner will tell you it’s not a great time to go and there are scorpions but it’s not true 😂) and then a little bit further there is a rocky path on the left that will lead you to the beach. DO NOT COME in VIETNAM IF YOU WANT A PLEASANT AND ENJOYABLE BEACH AND SEA LIFE.   Ong Lang beach .....the norrh part is not accessible , only private.....the south part ..there was no beach at all , maybe you can have beach only when the tide is low....Many beaches in Phu Quoc are full of garbage (i add some photos), It is dirty, plastic and other kind of rubbish everywhere.  If you are looking for an enjoyable beach and sea life i strongly advise NOT TO COME HERE!!!! Look for some other countries

Nice long beach without resorts (meanwhile), but with trees - you can hang up your hamaka...
Cold drinks you can buy at Eco beach Resort at the south end.
A lovely morning walk along the beach up to Cua Can and onward. It's a rare beach in Phu Quoc island with less tourists, resorts and commercial issues.

We were looking for a nice free beach for snorkeling and this is by far the best spot we found. Beautiful sea, lots of colorful fishies, relatively little garbage in the water (plenty on the beach tho), and not too many tourists around.
You’ll have to enter through a resort, marked by a big turquoise gate on the main road, but we had no trouble going in on our moped, and the guard didn’t seem to mind (we were very obviously tourists tho).
A perfect end to our trip to Phu Quoc!

data.formatted_address: Starfish Beach, Rạch Vẹm, Phú Quốc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Starfish Beach

reviews.text:
It feels like a scam. There is a man who will quickly gather the starfish as boats appear and places them on the beach for visitors. This is not good for the starfish as they are stressed and often out on the sand where they can't breathe.

Highly recommend to avoid this place so that they stop the practice.

The road is under construction and the beach is not great

It's a beautifull beach that has alot of starfish. The last part to the beach is either by foot or boat. Boat price around 150 to 200k per person is not uncommon.

At the beach if you get there early you can really enjoy the peacefulness. If you get there later then be prepared to see a lot of tourists.

Especially some tourists from specific countries behave like animals. Picking up starfish to pose with them, keeping them out of the water for minutes on end. (See pictures.)  Please if you go there just behave, let the starfish be and just enjoy them from where they're laying. Don't take them out of the water cause they can't breath out of water.

The road to access it is under construction and is difficult to drive on. Arrived to a sh*thole which we thought was the starfish beach…. No

We were forced to pay 30USD for a 5 minute return boat transfer to the next beach along. The beach is small, full of rubbish. Deckchairs cost 50,000 dong each. The starfish were nice.

Disappointed after a 1 hour drive each way, the beach at our hotel is nicer.

The journey to Starfish Beach by scooter was a bit of a hassle. The road is not finished and is still under construction. We were greeted just before the beach and asked to park the scooter there. They told us that the beach could only be reached by boat. 200,000 dong per person. As we didn't have much time, we decided to follow the signs. A few meters further on there was parking and we followed the path to the beach. We were also welcomed there, boat trip 150,000 dong. We walked along the beach where it was marked on Google Maps. Apart from jetties and dirty water, there was no starfish to be seen. So we decided to take a boat 100,000 dong per person for 10 minutes to Starfish Beach.
Conclusion: the whole thing is highly commercialized. Before the transfer you wait in a restaurant, before you are taken back you should let the store owner know and preferably buy a drink. We later found out that it is probably also possible without a boat. Theoretically, you can walk along the beach or take a scooter. You are definitely not alone, you can hire a jet ski. There are chairs everywhere to sit on and swings for photos. Knowing this, we would have approached the visit differently.

It's terrible. Most of the starfishes are dead or slowly dying. And idiots are making selfies with them. You cann see on the pictures how employee is collecting the dead starfishes and throws them back to the water....here and there you cann also see dead fish floathing or fish Head floating in the water...poor starfishes... Also the beach is very dirty and polited with plastic waste.

data.formatted_address: Vung Bau Beach, Cửa Cạn, Phú Quốc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Vung Bau Beach

reviews.text:
can't access!!
Why to go to Vietnam at all??
No beach road, no drive/walk along the beach  at sunset.
most beaches are private, the public one are hard to access and full of trash!
No feeling of an island, no holiday feeling too.
No wonder so many hotels stay empty. Something goes wrong with Vietnam tourism Program. Can't hold up with Thailand, wasted potential!

A Private date on the beach & unforgettable experiences of us!
In the Northern Phu Quoc lies a turquoise & tranquil bay named Half-moon Bay (or Vũng Bầu Bay) where you can freely enjoy kayaking with a very little chance of a crowdedness ahead.
My partner & I experienced the route of 4 km long from Half-moon beach, passing by Fingernail Island before reaching Casuarina Beach for relaxing & drinking tropical coconut water then we continued to paddle back to the shore. When the sun came down on the water, we also finished the wonderful paddle which lasted around 3 hours of fun, chill & retreat. It followed by a romantic dinner right on the beach.
We hope to share this exotic experience for those enthusisatic couples out there who are also seeking for private dates on the beach like we used to, it would be perfect!!!

Unfortunately, as we’d like to enjoy the wholeness of us together while paddling,  we didn’t bring the camera with us so these photos were taken before & after the paddle. :)

Just ask google for #Half-moon Beach, #Vung Bau Bay and they will guide you there somehow.

We arrived around 10am in the morning and we had the beach all by ourselves. A bit of bumpy roads but least of an issue compared to nusa penida. Wear a mask and don’t wear white! You will thank me for that later. Bike parking is free. Beach is about 100-200m walk from there. It’s truly a hidden gem with clear water and peaceful surroundings. Do bring your own drinks and food as there isn’t any stall around. Please keep this beautiful beach clean! We left about 12pm and saw a lot of locals coming in for lunch break.

Following the dirt road on a scooter is fun. The beach, where we were is long and in principle empty.  There was no sign of infrastructure i.e. huts, bars, benches etc., just the sandy beach.  At some point along the dirt road further north we had to turn around as a big excavator blocked the way. Even the scooter could not pass. Following another road under construction it was a, in a way, to see the forrest being destroyed on such scale.

This could be one of the best spots on the island if it wasn't full of trash. There are still large sandy areas that are quite nice. The red dirt roads make for an adventurous drive to the beach which was a bonus for me.

data.name: Dinh Bà Thủy Long Thánh Mẫu

reviews.text:
A beautiful and popular Vietnamese temple just off the beach and the lighthouse of Phu Quoc city. If you are coming to see the rocky sea views and the lighthouse, you have every reason to drop by this temple dedicated to the fisherfolk of the area (and their safety). I found especially interesting the altars where idols were replaced by Chinese character representations of the deity's name.

Pro-Tip: I like visiting places of worship of all types but needless to say, I hope, be respectful and do not disturb worshippers. In my experience, in Vietnamese temples, photography is acceptable but try to be discreet.

This is the "female" temple of the pair Dinh Cậu ( male) and Dinh Bà, erected to pray for the safety of the fishermen as this was the main activity on the island in bygone years. Note the beautiful engraved floor tiles! Also the "fortune sticks" in the bamboo holders: you shake them until a numbered stick falls out, then you collect your fortune from the numbered 1 - 100, rack on the wall! Wish you good fortune!

Small temple near to the river mouth. There is another shrine which is a few paces away. Well preserved temple with heavy crafting on the wall and floor. The outer of the temple is an impressive architecture.
Beautiful place. Not many tourists there. Not much description in English about the temple. But found it interesting and got some positive vibes.

Nice , relaxing , peaceful place for prayers
You can do donations and burn encens.

data.formatted_address: 8VG5+9WX Grand World, Bãi Dài, Gành Dầu, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Cầu Ánh Sáng

reviews.text:
This is the best platform to watch the music show. Water music show is at 21:30
People started to line up on the bridge for a good location from before 21:00. Great show.

How to get here: The best options for most people is hop on the free tuk tuk bus or just pay for a private one. If you know how to ride a bicycle, another option is rent the electric motorbike to whiz around. There are rental places right next to T1 which means you can go around and then come back and hop straight on the bus.
There are 2 main car park for the area: T1 and T2. If you are staying at the resorts, most of the buses stop at T1.

Photo tip: To take the best photo of the bridge you prob need to be on the side walk or from the boat.

Annoyance: So many people smoking which is frustrating. The worst part is when the bridge is packed for the music show and people keep lighting up cigarette.

Free night show here every night at 9.30 PM
Bring umbella in case of rain

The colors of Venice take place every night from 9:30, but on Saturdays and Sundays there are fireworks that are no worse than New Year's Eve. Those who want to continue playing can go to the Indochina area to party
The musical water show is a magical experience, combining exquisite music and a unique water performance. Soft lighting combined with water projections creates a mysterious and sparkling picture

Not enough stores
The performance is a bit lengthy

data.formatted_address: Thị trấn Hoàng Hôn, Bãi Đất Đỏ, phường, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Kiss of the Sea show - Nụ hôn của Biển Cả

reviews.text: This show is a do-not-miss if you’re staying in/ near Sunset town! We found it super impressive and truly enjoyed. The fireworks at the end were beautiful, although this wasn’t necessary for me as the show itself was already quite beautiful with all the lights and performances! 😊😍 great show

The sounds, lights and fireworks were good. However, I don’t understand the story and was in a rainy day with many people holding umbrella, which kinda ruined everything.

1. You can not cancel or reschedule if its a bad weather, like today we spent millions VND and seated in a open air theater ☔️☔️

2. You have to pay 70,000VND to buy a disposable raincoat and still got shorts wet. Well, as a nearly everyday performance, they should well-prepare for a rainy season, any canopy, half open-air would help…instead of forcing guests to buy raincoat if they didn’t bring with a umbrella..4 of us paid 280,000 VND and NOT ACCEPT CREDIT CARD!

3. NO performers in rainy day. What a pity! We just paid for the light, sounds, (rain and thunder) and confused story…

Please improve…I have a high expectation but end up a bit of disappointment. The route planning, alternative rainy plan, reschedule or refund, could do better.
During this visit, there was no performer participating in the show. However, the light effects were still breathtaking. The fireworks followed by the show was also amazing.

Best laser show/fireworks I have ever seen. I dont get how anybody would rate this less then 5 stars. If you got to the aquapark trough the day the entrance here is free. Such a value for money is something I have never seen.

Had no expectations coming into the show but our hotel recommended we visit. The ushers were extremely friendly waving and welcoming us in. We were early so got fantastic seats at the front as it is not allocated seating.

The show itself was epic. Good use of lighting, visuals and water displays. Nice and short (35 minutes) and by the end after the fireworks I was speechless. The firework show was the most incredible display.

data.formatted_address: 8VG6+5WP, Ganh Dau, Phú Quốc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Teddy Bear Museum

reviews.text:
So this is the cutest museum ever. I was absolutely enthralled. I give it only 4 stars though, because as you wander through the museum you see Teddy Jones in his little safari suit doing all sorts of amazing things. So you can imagine how excited I was to get to the gift shop and buy a Teddy Jones to take away with me as a souvenir.

No Teddy Jones in the gift shop. Just random not very cute bears. And stuffed sharks. Why would you not have Teddy Jones ready to go? I would have bought at least 3.
We loved the miniature landscapes! They’re a bit static but beautifully designed and manufactured. Great for taking a million pics :))

A nice place to visit with kids. Feels a bit overpriced at 300k vnd (for example, safari is 500k and it's a whole day experience, this museum is 30 minutes tops)
Animated dioramas are worth seeing.

It's cute and good to visit with kids, there are areas for improvement. The total time spent maybe less than 30 min in the museum. The passport stamps is good idea but instead making it fun, the card already fully stamped and we just need to bring it back. Playground area is a plus. Arts and craft section is good but can be more varieties. The teddy bear show schedule not mentioned clearly in the booklet.

Souvenir shops price tag is affordable. Overall good time with the kids best time to visit during evening, so you can ride boat afternath.

There are many lovely bears, and they showed you many funny bear artworks.
There is also a teddy theme cafe serving good drinks.

data.formatted_address: Island, Commune, ĐT 975, Dương Tơ, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Sol by Meliá Phu Quoc

reviews.text:
Amazing time with my family there.
I spent my birthday with my family. Room is very clean and comfortable. From the balcony, we enjoyed ocean and sky. Walking in the garden and swimming in the pool are relaxing time. Breakfast has different menu and we enjoyed Vietnam foods.

Hotel try clean beach everyday so it is beautiful beach in front of the hotel. But garbage in the ocean is all our daily homework topic.

Especially, happy people work at the place and they create peace and beautiful atmosphere. Thank you for the birthday message and tasty cake !

Great hotel and wonderful staff.

The hotel's a quick 10-minute ride from the airport, and they've got someone waiting for you when you arrive, just make sure you inform them before.
Checking in is quick and easy, and they even greet you with a drink!
The rooms are cozy and has a great view, and breakfast has a ton of tasty options.
The beach and swimming pool are amazing. And this is the best place to watch the sunset.

The staff are super friendly and helpful—they'll take care of anything you need, special thanks to Bao for his warm hospitality, and his French is a real plus.
If we come back to Phu Quoc, we'll be back for sure.

The location is very close to the airport and the hotel provides airport shuttle transfer to and from the hotel, but it was very limited on time. We find it unnecessary to set a time for the airport transfers according to certain times for pick up. We arrived earlier before pick up time so we ended up calling a taxi to take us instead. Other than that, the location is far from most destinations if you're driving yourself on a scooter so I recommend to take a Grab to every destination for comfort.

Our rooms were clean and very large which was great, however the hotel amenities is very limited. Wish there was more entertainment and cleaner beach for the guests as we can see clearly why the beautiful beach was empty for the 6 days we were there.

We purchased a tequila bottle (Two Fingers) for 1.8mm and was really surprised they didn't come with chasers like orange juice etc. Not everyone can drink the liquor straight and need something light to diffuse it. Food was very expensive at the hotel so we ordered take out via Grab on days that were rainy. A burger was 385k compared to what you could order on Grab for 90k...

The ping pong area should be air conditioned to motivate guests to play.

The free breakfast buffet was satisfactory, not excellent.
We expected much more from this property as we have stayed in other Melias around the world with better attention to details for the guests so we were quite disappointed overall and will be going back to Vinpearl Golf when we return to Phu Quoc in the future.

Resort style hotel, very (very !) isolated from the rest of the world : there is absolutely nothing at walking distance, not even the smallest convenience store. The rooms are very good, modern, comfortable, large and with all amenities working fine (the water tank is a great idea, would be even more good with non-breakable bottles...). The onsite restaurants are super expensive and the food is so so (Ola Spanish restaurant). The buffet breakfast has a lot of choices, but taste is average (especially, the pastries are awfully bad, soups and eggs stations are good, juices and fruits are just ok...). The Check in / Check Out was average (not fast, not too slow) but they don't trust you on your departure, and they will make you wait until they have checked you did not stole something !.... oh and the weather was horrible (for sure the hotel cannot do anything against that, but I wonder why VietNam is trying to build a resort in this island with such bad weather most of the time)

We had a pool access room. Beautiful and clean room, everything in the room you need except a cold minibar, that was warm. The grounds are magnificent pool would be amazing if it were cooler.
Breakfast just like everywhere else, nothing special though Ola restaurant and The Shack food is delicious. Not cheap to drink at the resort, you expect a mark up but not Australian prices. We got the all inclusive for 2 days, drinks were limited and not a lot of variety, the alcohol was their local brand and just awful. Reception and restaurants were hot.
Couldn't use the beach due to "worms" not their fault. The location was a disaster, miles away from anywhere. Pool was like a warm bath 90% of our stay. When we arrived hardly any information was provided, told to scan the QR codes. WiFi was not secure

data.formatted_address: 22 Đường Trần Hưng Đạo, TT. Dương Đông, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam

reviews.text: Ok beach and surprisingly clean considering it's downtown location, I had a great swim here and watched an awesome sunset! It gets busy here in the late afternoon when the locals come for some beach and picnic time, but it's a good, happy atmosphere!

One of the best beaches to see the sunset. There are many bars and restaurants that have opened until late night where you can sit and have a drink. Due to littering and many hotels with sewage pipes leading to the beach there is often not a good smell and garbage in the water. Its not a good place for swimming, even some people do this. Also there are many construction sites along the beach where many new hotels are being constructed, therefore carefully check if you will have a calm sleep when booking your hotel and read the hotel reviews carefully. The beach itself is very narrow as most sand has apparently washed already into the ocean. Photos on hotel pages often show a wider beach from years ago which is different from now.
Not a beach you’d lay on the sand or swim at. Good to sit at one of the hotel bars or restaurants and watch the sunset from though.
Love phuquoc! Star beach is the best
Quite quiet for a beach just next to the night market, just a bit rocky.

The laundry service is also well priced and they were happy to keep our bags after we checked out. We would highly recommend this place, great value.

data.formatted_address: Bãi Dài, Gành Dầu, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 922200, Vietnam
data.name: Vinpearl Safari Phú Quốc

reviews.text: Went with a 4 and 6 year old. Easily traversable with a stroller. Plenty of animals, good amount of greenery and nice enclosures. Most rhinos I've ever seen at a conservation area. Pretty cool. The included meals vouchers will feed you easily. Worth it

It is said to be the best zoo in Vietnam - the Safari zoo on Phu Quoc Island.
This time I finally had time to experience it during my holidays.

-The zoo is located in the northern part of Phu Quoc Island. If you stay in a central or southern hotel, it will take about an hour to drive there, so it is recommended that you should arrange your itinerary in advance.

-The zoo is not very large, if you really walk very quick, you can visit all the area in about 5-6 hours. Because the second half of the area is only open to toor-buses for viewing.

*The park bus part is divided into two types:
1. The first is a free guided tour bus, which takes about 20-30 minutes and will take you around the park for large wild animals. You can get up close with animals on the bus. And the important thing is that it has air conditioning, which can avoid the very hot sunlight.
2. The second type is a small tour-car, which requires an additional fee, I remembe is about VND100,000-200,000/per one. It will take you to three main areas for viewing. If you have difficulty in mobility, it is recommended to take this facility.

-Zoo ticket price: We bought it from Klook this time. It costs about USD 30 per person, which is actually not cheap. In particular, food in the park also requires additional charges, so actually is not really valuable.

Overall, most of the experience in the zoo includes close interactions with animals, their routes arrangements and facilities are very good. It is highly recommended to experience it.
However, judging from zoos in other countries, the fees here are really too high! 🤣
Lovely place to visit. Safari bus was good. The giraffe enclosure was the best, just loved watching these beautiful animals from the coffee lounge.

We went at about 9:30 am, which I recommend as it can get quite hot. My partner wanted to feed the giraffes so that's the first thing we did. Afyer which we wandered in the direction of the safari. I should also add that the gentlemen at the front recommended we head to safari first as it will hit rush hour by 10:30/11am. However, the queue moved fast and we didn't feel like we waited at all. The safari lasted about 23 minutes and I enjoyed it. You stop off in different section via the safari bus and we saw a multitude of animals up close. The park itself is lovely and well maintained. As a south african myself I will add this is not a safari in the proper sense but rather an attempt to recreate the experience on a smaller scale. We spent about 4 hours THERE and as someone who's sceptical about "zoos" I have to say that the animals are the park's first priority and I'm happy so many rescues found a home. My only complaint was that the chameleons were terrible, I spotted them IMMEDIATLY 😂

Amazing place, must go if you are at Phu Quoc island! Better to book tickets beforehand via official website cause you can get the discount for combo tickets. Better to get the zoo tram (weather is hot during April, moving around might be challenging). We got lunch voucher (promo) for 200K VND enough to have very nice lunch 🥗 Safari will take around 30 mins via special bus (ensure your place close to window). Absolutely amazing experience! Highly recommended!

reviews.text: Highly recommended place! Worthy of revisiting. Also, I want to express sincere gratitude to the gentle keeper sister at the lemur area this afternoon. Two mischievous little boys suddenly got scared and cried, but thanks to the patient and gentle care of the keeper sister, the two boys were eventually comforted and successfully got the lemurs to take pictures on them, creating a wonderful experience.

The show started at 2PM when we were there. Make sure to check with information to verify the schedule. It worths watching. It’s near the gate so just make sure calculate the time to walk there.
If you visit the park late in the day then may want to do the show first before going through the park. If you go early then it’s not bad to do: walk around - tour - some lunch at giraffe restaurant - back to the show and then go back to hotel. 🤔
The weather is warm and humid so make sure you have sunscreen, hat, water, and maybe even some portable fan.

I had the chance to attend the animal show at Phu Quoc Grand Safari at 2pm. The show mainly featured a variety of birds, each displaying their vibrant colors and natural behaviors. However, it's important to note that the show was conducted in Vietnamese, which made it a bit challenging to understand the commentary. Despite the language barrier, the visual spectacle was quite impressive. If you're a bird enthusiast, this could be an enjoyable experience for you.

data.name: Phu Quoc Night Market

reviews.text: A little bit touristy but definitely worth the visit! There's plenty of good food to choose from. Lots of sight and smells will attract you to each of the food stalls that line this food street. There are also lots of spa places around. It's most lively at night. I definitely recommend trying the coconut ice-cream and seafood!

Small and intimate night market with great seafood and easy to navigate. Right on the river so plenty of seafood. Beautiful views of the fishing boats from the bridge at the end... Friendly, safe and fun.

It was okay. Very touristy. There are multiple of the same stalls and so they did not have much variety in terms of food. Seafood bbq, skewers, ice cream scrolls, banh khot, spring rolls and juices. That’s really all you’re going to get.  But still worth checking out as the night market vibes are fun
Good night out. Friendly people, be ready to be asked by every stall to buy their products. Products are repeated through out entire market. Good fun negotiating prices.

If fresh grilled seafood straight off a boat is your thing, this is the night market for you. A weaving set of vendor lined lanes adjacent to the fishing fleet moored at the docks in Duong Dong.

Tanks of fresh fish and shellfish line the lantern lit lanes with charcoal grills and seating. Always super busy too. But you basically point and choose (obviously after haggling for some market price stuff) and have it grilled and on your table in under10 minutes.

A few bars and cafes are interspersed amongst the fish sellers too. Great and simple evening out if you're staying in Duong Dong.

reviews.text: Very good and trendy drink from Dream Punch bar. Reasonable price

At the night market, there are many restaurants selling seafood and most of them sell live seafood. Seafood is presented on tables or boat models, which look very eye-catching, especially the seafood here. Freshly caught on the same day, the taste will definitely be different from frozen seafood.
Seafood such as fish, crabs, mantis shrimp, shrimp, etc. are all alive and floating in the aquarium because expensive seafood like these are at least crabs or shrimp. It is only best when prepared when the crab and shrimp are still alive, so they can retain the delicious sweet taste of the seafood. If the crab is cooked, the shrimp will be softer but will not be as delicious as fresh food. Sitting at the restaurant, observing the flow of people meditating, sipping cups of sim wine and enjoying grilled seafood dishes, grilled shrimp, satay, grilled squid, grilled fish, grilled bien mai with salt and pepper, grilled clams with onion fat, just thinking about it is delicious. Already . The aroma of grilled seafood makes it difficult for passing tourists to appease, so the seafood shops at Phu Quoc night market are always crowded with customers. In addition to grilled seafood,  you can enjoy steamed seafood or  some seafood dishes prepared with island flavors.
Almost nobody there in rainy season and weekday. Not too sure about weekend. But I think this place is suitable for those stay around and don't want to go far to Duong Dong town

Decent food market with mostly food stalls and souvenirs. Very touristy, but we ate some nice grilled seafood. Tourist prices.

Colourful, lively,... there are so many foods to choose. Almost anything can be be found. I like the smell of different foods the moment I entered. It's good to give it a walk and check if you need something.

It's located in the main town. If you are staying in the main town, this is definitely worth checking out!

First night in Phu quoc and me and my friend ate here and ended up having diarrhoea the next few days.

It’s always a risk when you eat at these might markets.
Situated near the port with Lots of seafood assessories. And of cos you be harnessed by street vendors. A good experience to soak in the local experience. Otherwise it's all expensive.

data.formatted_address: 1 Đường Trần Hưng Đạo, TT. Dương Đông, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 92506, Vietnam
data.name: PHU QUOC CENTRE

reviews.text: I see a lot of ads, people say it's a new night market, but it's not very small, I don't know what to do here.  In addition, the toilets here are all locked, only a few are open but very dirty.  In general, there is nothing fancy here.
Nice little enclave of businesses and restaurants

Although crowded, the seafood seems iffy, the sellers were more persistent than normal, so to me it felt like it was not the place to spend money, but very nice to look at and observe... Would have given one star but they had one stall that sold shaved icecream (Korean style) and it was actually nice!
Nice variety of foods,  well maintained and clean.  nice atmosphere
Hip people, diversity style but fun and evironment friendly 🥰🥰🥰🥰

data.formatted_address: 8VG4+5WX Grand World, ĐD2-31, Gành Dầu, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Phố đi bộ - chợ đêm Phú Quốc

reviews.text: If you ever visited GrandWorld night market, you should try Mai Huong restaurant. Reasonable rate, fresh seafood and their cooking was way better than others. Don't try Ham Ninh seafood in Grandworld because they had dead seafood, more expensive and cooking sucked.

Many seafood stalls which I found to have much better pricing than the expensive restaurants around. Just ask them the price of the seafood by the kg and compare to the other stalls to get the best value.

This area is super beautiful but the night market is quite deserted inside. Even though I went on a holiday, there were quite a few guests. If you go out to eat, you should visit a 2-3 restaurant that sells seafood and hot pot at affordable prices. The rest is mainly for experience

Cool, close to the beach, but few places to eat seafood, mainly light snacks, noodles, grilled sausages, if you have a good dinner, you should not visit here, there is milk tea, the usual snacks are 1 Some good beer bars, walking around is cool, prices are ok, park your car on the block above or nearby and go down, the road is clean and beautiful, give me a like.

Restaurant 68 on the walking street sells bad food, expensive, not delicious, asked for squid at 400/1kg but charged 450k/1kg (eating 4 grilled squids costs 200k) I give up on restaurant 68, I won't visit these times. This area for dinner. So bad, so bad

data.formatted_address: 128 Đường Bạch Đằng, TT. Dương Đông, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Dương Đông Night Market

reviews.text: You can feel the natural, local Vietnamese night market. There are lots of peanut stores, and they give sample peanuts. A lot of peanuts are on your hand after wandering the market.
Just not my type of market. Felt a little hesitant to try the seafood. Just played safe and had some standard dishes, but it wasn’t that good.
Overpriced food. Basically the whole night market selling almost the same thing. Stalls are repeated at tourists price. Our hotel restaurant had better pricing for the food

30 minutes after eating big shellfish we started feeling very bad, dizzy, double seeing, and after hour we went to hospital, weak and vomitting. Doctor said it is common that some clams have saxitoxine which is poisonous after eating them, so better avoid this seafood. Worst night in Vietnam

Went there around 6 pm to experience the night market once. We were not disappointed at all - the atmosphere is quite impressive with all the buzz, lights, and impressions. We didn’t eat or drink anything except for a beer.

Expect to be invited to every single shop, see a lot of food (dead and alive), and overpriced souvenirs.

data.formatted_address: Shophouse Venice 26, Sun Địa Trung Hải, Sun Premier Village Primavera, Khu phố 6, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 100000, Vietnam
data.name: The Kiss Bridge Villa - Cầu Hôn Homestay

reviews.text: The homestay is new and spacious. Nice rooms and amenities. Super nice host. The neighborhood is really nice to take pictures. The only thing is that you need a motorcycle to get around.

Such a beautiful and clean  property. Bed is soft and comfy, very good water pressure. It’s quiet at night, had a good sleep.
The host is nice as well.
Thumbs up🌼

Nice and unique homestay.
You should experience this homestay once to know how beautiful it is !
Everything here is good. Perfect service. Overall everything in the room is new and complete. This place and it’s wonderful staff are worth every penny! Do stay!
The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was really nice. All are super clean. Friendly staff and good support.

data.formatted_address: Thiền viện Trúc Lâm Hộ Quốc, Dương Tơ, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Quốc Mẫu Hall

reviews.text: Take the cable car and you will see a very beautiful scene. When you get there, you don't have to queue. Go up for about 10-15 minutes and you will see a very large statue. At this time, the wind is very strong and there are many people in the area.  When visiting locals, please prepare food and water because there are quite a few restaurants here

If temples are your thing then you will appreciate this place. It has a fresh feel, probably recently build. it was very deserted here. I got the feel that people make their way here deliberately in search for something interesting whilst visiting the island but for most it was a quick stop.
Lovely place to visit that is Free
Great monuments looking out the greatly open sea in front in brightly pleasant colors, very appropriate for beautifully surrounding tropical beaches and ocean, away from busy towns.. ^&^

It's beautiful.
They are building a new forum of tower.
