reviews.text: Security told us "no" and closed the door when we tried to enter. Normal attire so not sure why
Nice place and quiet
Very nice retro gallery but was very hot on the top floors
Looks nice on pictures but is actually dead inside

I came here for the first time with my friends. This seems to be a part of New World. Really impressed with the ballroom.
What I say you can see through the image that I will send below.

data.formatted_address: 22H3+7G4, An Thoi, Phú Quốc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Cầu Hôn Phú Quốc

reviews.text: We visited the kissing bridge after the Kiss Of The Sea show. While the stores were already closed, the decorative lights still render the bridge with romantic ambience. The view for Sunset Town was also great.

Absolutely incredible piece of architecture....breathtaking. Definitely worth visiting and the sunset was beautiful. Only a short ride by car across the island from Khem Beach (that's another review entirely) so both places can be visited in one day trip - and should be!!

The kiss bridge is absolutely amazing place and it worths taking time and see around. Amazing shows and incredible view especially in dawn. However, the photographers need to work a lot on scamming people. We asked for the pictures, firstly  they asked us to pay first, so we did. We only asked them about the people at the background if they could remove. They agreed and assure us that they will remove people in the background. Secondly when we went to the bridge we didn’t even realize when they clicked picture just like in 5 seconds. When we asked them to show us pictures to confirm they are good or not. They said “oh we will edit them and send you tonight” and this is what we got at the end of the day.
I don’t recommend to get into their game and pay for taking those beautiful shots which you never gonna get.  Better to take pictures by yourself waste of money !

I was utterly impressed by the Kiss Bridge experience in Phu Quoc. The modern construction is a testament to love, with a heartwarming touch that resonates throughout the entire walk. The love poem in different languages along the bridge wall filled my heart, creating a truly special atmosphere.

The connection between the two bridges is symbolic and heartwarming, making the entire stroll an immersive journey of love. It's a perfect place to pause, take a breath, and enjoy the beautiful view while reflecting on the people who bring love into your life.

The message of love is clear and resonates with every visitor, making it a unique and meaningful experience. Many thanks for providing a place that encourages us to appreciate love and the special moments in life.

ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!! There’s an impressive water show included every night besides Tuesdays starting at 8:30pm.

Also I found out that every Wednesday, Thursday, and Saturday there’s the water show at 8:30 and at 9pm there’s the firework show. Which is the best firework show I’ve ever seen in my life! Way better then the 4th of July shows I’ve seen in the states!!!!

Must see attraction in Phu Quoc! I just sat on the beach to view it for free but there are a ton of different view points!

data.formatted_address: Phu Quoc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Phu Quoc

data.formatted_address: 22J4+3RF, An Thoi, Phú Quốc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Sunset Town Beach

reviews.text: Amazing place.   Our driver told us it has only been open a month.  We drop by right around sunset where they do some sort of performance for the kissing bridge.   There is also a water show.  Overall this town is so brand new.  Architecture wise it has European theme. Near by is also a night market.  Price wise it’s very reasonable and not tourist price.  Most of the food are pretty much local price which I appreciate.  A must try experience

Slightly surreal southern Italian style but very nicely done. The beach is nice and quiet and there are free loungers. Water is calm and protected when the wind is blowing on Sao and Khem. Food and drinks in the area are Western prices almost but it's a nice environment...just a pity so much of it is still unoccupied. Definitely worth a visit for Sunset and the 'Kiss of the Sea' Show is amazing.

I'm giving it 5 stars base on my experienced.. Saturday Jan 27th. We stayed here for more than 6 hrs and its not packed with tourists, just exactly how I wanted it. There's a lot to see, beautiful Italy inspired architectures, sunset, bridge, beach and what I love the most is there's plenty of shade where you can lay your towels on and enjoy the breeze.
We had a very good time during sunset and theres plenty of good restaurants where you can have a decent dinner by the beach with a perfect view.
It's a good place  for an afternoon relaxation while waiting for the Sunset on the Kiss bridge or the Kiss of the sea show early night.
Over all experience was amazing and recommended if you love less touristy place.

Seems like a recreation of Amalfi coast in Italy and mix of others. Beautiful nevertheless, and some cool places around, including the kissing bridge, Starbucks, and some cool cafes and a market. Loads of accommodation and hotels and a fireworks show in the area.

It's really freaky to see this fake Italian setting on an island in Vietnam but really awesome at the same time. We sat at a bar that overlooked the water and the sunset was beautiful to watch even though this particular night was cloudy. Unfortunately there was virtually no body around and it was like a ghost town. Maybe it was because we visited in October when the cable car was closed for maintenance. Anyway I hope this place takes off because I think it would be pretty cool to stay there.

data.formatted_address: Ấp cây thông trong, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 91000, Vietnam
data.name: Vườn thuốc

data.formatted_address: TL48, Hàm Ninh, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Jade Mountain Resort & Bar

reviews.text:
Very nice resort with causy rooms.
The pool is very nice.
The staff,Daniel and Two are amazing.
They speak English very well and are great.
Price for value with this staff is the very best we had in 2 months South Asia.
Eric

I stayed here for a little over 2 weeks with my wife and dog and everything was great. The couple running it (Trang and Christian) and staff are super friendly and hospitable, super helpful. Our bungalow was in good condition and comfortable. The pool area was clean and nice to use, and while the resort doesn't have it's own beach access, we were allowed to use the beach at a nearby resort where the water was clean and calm. Overall the vibe is super chill, quiet, and relaxed there

Do be aware that the resort is fairly far from most things on the island (30-40 minutes from the main town area on the island where most tourists go, 15 minutes from a local town area with a market and some shops) but if you want a chill getaway more in nature it's a fantastic location. They put us in touch with a reliable motorbike rental place, who dropped it off at the resort for us, and they had a taxi driver we could text to pick us up whenever we needed a ride. The restaurant at the resort is fantastic (mostly western dishes with some Asian ones), and nearby are some local stores with basics, across the street is a great beach/sports bar and restaurant called Rory's, there are some local seafood places along the coast, and decent amount of other resorts with bar/restaurants too not far away.
Peaceful place to enjoy the sun rise. Quiet and wonderful view!

Beautiful room, restaurant with seaview. Woke up to birds chirping and the sounds of tree leaves. Very wonderful. Ms. Thao at the place is extremely accommodating to make the guests as comfortable and convenient as possible. Food is very good here, highly recommend. The shower head in our two-bedroom chalet has a crack in it and the water took quite a while to warm up. They also unfortunately mixed up our booking and we had to move to another chalet during our stay.

A beautiful, serene, chilled spot, nestled on a jungle hill, beautiful view of the ocean, infinity pool fed by mountain spring. And the loveliest hosts you could ever hope to meet, Trang and Christian. Fantastic base for motorbike trips around the island. One of the best holidays we’ve ever had.

data.formatted_address: City, Village, Ong Lang Hamlet, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 920000, Vietnam
data.name: Mövenpick Resort Waverly Phu Quoc

reviews.text: This resort is top-notch 👌🏽. It's beautifully structured and spacious. Amazing staff ready to help whenever. Their breakfast selection is big and delicious 😋 There are 3 restaurants at the resort, and the food is great but a bit expensive compared to the average price in Vietnam 🇻🇳

Amazing resort! We stayed in the Superior King Room with direct pool access and it is a must! Super relaxing being able to walk from your room straight into the pool. All the staff were super friendly and really helpful. Breakfast selection was amazing and the chocolate hour every day was incredible!
Be aware the resort is about 20 minutes out of town however the resort has everything you need.

reviews.author_name: Andy 小黑哥 (Andy 小黑哥)
reviews.text: It was an unforgettable experience. This is one of the best hotels in Vietnam. The staff and the service were spectacular. They were super nice, helpful and very detail oriented. The breakfast was amazing, they had plenty of choices. Overall, we had a wonderful time and we would like to say special thanks to Mr Tung & Ms Chi. They are hardworking and very attentive people.

It was wonderful to have a vacation here, the service surprised me, everything was magnificent, 5-star service, many breakfast dishes, beautiful and green beach, clean and tidy rooms, The staff is quite friendly, I remember a person in the lobby area, named Tracy, I asked her some questions about the hotel and Phu Quoc Island, this person is very smart, she seems to know very well. about the hotel environment and being a Phu Quoc person, surprisingly she gave me many messages about the island in a wonderful way. My room had a little problem, she handled it very quickly, making me satisfied, thank you. you very much.

Large property boasting great sunset views on the days the clouds aren't covering. We were not informed by agent that the main swimming pool was under renovations during our stay. Front desk staff Henry was very quick and kind of offer us an upgrade. The torrential rains during the week led to a water leak in our upgraded room. Front desk manager Nga went above and beyond to make our stay as memorable as she could.

Would be the ideal location for families provided weather is clear and sunny.

data.formatted_address: 5XCC+P4J, Dương Tơ, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Swing Pier

reviews.text: Pretty nice place at least for a photo.
Nice beach, view of landing planes

data.formatted_address: Duong Dong Lake, Cửa Dương, Phu Quoc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Duong Dong Lake

reviews.text:
Not much tourist here so this is the good play for people who don't like crowded place.

The water is clear,warm but not for swimming coz this is the lake to keep clear water for the  island so please keep clean and tidy when we visit.

The way to come here now very easy coz the road had covered properly evenly in rain season. Cherrr
Nice lake, windy and not crowded
Ugly and devastated land. Thanks vietnam😳
Just Relax on your weekends.
Rich vegetation around the large lake. There are two streams flowing into the lake: Da Ngon Lon stream and Da Ngon Nho stream. There are many large fish in the lake and the water is extremely clean.

data.formatted_address: Khem Beach, Phu Quoc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Khem Beach

reviews.text: It was our favourite beach in Phu Quoc. We weren’t sure of what to expect based on the mixed reviews, but decided to give it a try. As soon as we arrived, we noticed a beautiful beach, with palm trees from the shade, white sands & clear water. There was a bit of trash in the water and the sand but nothing crazy, and because there is a huge hotel on the beach, they have people cleaning the beach constantly, so hopefully this improved with time. Free scooter parking & no fees to enter the beach.

The beach was the highlight of Phu Quoc for us. Amazing views from the restaurants on the edge. Extremely affordable craft beer from craft beer bar and happy hour on cocktails from another 2 down. 100% worth going. Some rubbish but local workers clean up well.
We love this white sand beach so much, visited few times during our stay in Phu Quoc. You can park your bike right next to beach and you don’t need to walk much. Not many people.

DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU WANT A PLEASANT AND ENJOYABLE BEACH AND SEA LIFE.A beautiful bay and beach clean only where are the resort, The north part (supposedly the free beach) is full of garbage, It is dirty, plastic and other kind of rubbish everywhere.  Of the other beaches we visited this is the most cared (meaning the resortbarea ). Behind the beach a ghost suburb of thousands and thousands of empty hotel rooms. If you are looking for an enjoyable beach and sea life i strongly advise NOT TO COME HERE!!!!
Nice beach but a bit of trash here and there, big waves. Prefer the beaches up north than south on the island, which is very much cleaner with soft white sands there!

data.formatted_address: Bãi Dài, Tp. Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Bãi Dài

reviews.text:
Nice sandy beach. Beware of the jellyfish depends on the weather. They are fairly docile so if you don’t disturb them they are fine. Quite hot. Not a lot of free shade to sit unless you have one of the beach villa.
People smoking like chimney ruining the fresh air from the sea 😩

This is a beautiful sandy beach the sand is actually really clean because the hotels take the time to clean any trash off the beach. Which is really a wonderful thing to do for the environment there is not a whole lot to do on the beach other than stroll or build Sandcastle’s waters a bit cold there are a few bars if you walk along drinks are about 150,000 VND
You can't visit this beach at all if you are not in some of the resorts. Very hard to understand why you cant just go there and pay since thats what we came for.....
Cannot access it even though all beaches in Vietnam are public! It's a big corruption scheme

No access to this beach, only for resort hotels visitors. All roads closed by Vinpearl security. It's breaks the Vietnam laws, looks like corruption rules there.
I'll never pay to Vinpearl services now.

data.formatted_address: Bãi biển Gành Dầu, Gành Dầu, Tp. Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Bãi biển Gành Dầu

reviews.text:
Most of the beaches on Phu Quoc are a bit dirty, that’s just how it is here. In time I’m sure they will clean up but for now this is what you get.

We still went for a swim to cool off after the ride from the other side of the island. Nice enough - the views are lovely:)

There is a restaurant near by you can get a cold beer or lunch. All in all - Worth a look
You can buy fresh fish in here from the local fisherman when they has just landfall ( ì you lucky). You can enjoy a cup of coffee on sidewalk and view the sea, the sea so clean at this season

Good place to enjoy sunset with your beloved and do fishing as well...
Local people usually swimming in the afternoon and from this site we can see some island of Cambodia.
The North of the island where strong windy from Jan to Jun of the year..other side will be from Jul to Dec.
A lot of hotel and small resort around.
Highly recommend from my side to go to Nam Phuong Resorts nearby..don’t forget to try steamed calamari and Bivina Beer.
Incredible location,amazing views,super sunset spit ,great place to go sailing and snorkeling
We're lucky when come here and see the rainbow. You can see some Cambodia islands from here. Quite peace, not so many tourists. I loved this place!

data.formatted_address: Cua Can Beach, Cửa Cạn, Phú Quốc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Cua Can Beach

reviews.text:
can't access!! PRIVATE :(
Why to go to Vietnam at all??
No beach road, no drive/walk along the beach  at sunset.
most beaches are private, the public one are hard to access and full of trash!
No feeling of an island, no holiday feeling too.
No wonder so many hotels stay empty. Something goes wrong with Vietnam tourism Program. Can't hold up with Thailand, wasted potential!

Although the private beach of the resort is not worth it, walking closer to the rivermouth and you will be rewarded with refreshing and clear waters as well as the only sand dune in the island! Remember to bring plenty of water or refreshments with you as there are no beach bars. The trash may be an issue but the water is clean. Bonus, the beach is covered with sand dollars!
Fantastic! My family have experienced so great. It’s nice and wild beach. However I saw some death jellyfishes on the beach. The sunset really beautiful.👍❤️

There is a sand bar by the river mouth which is consistently dredged but our mother nature always knows how to get it reshaped in a short time. Walking closer to the river mouth and you will be rewarded with refreshing and clear waters as well as the only sand dune on the island! Remember to bring plenty of water or refreshments with you as there are no beach bars. The trash may be an issue but the water is clean. Bonus, the beach is covered with sand dollars!

While riding the motorbike to the north of the island, we saw a sing stating "Beach - Picnic". Since we had Binh Mí (Vietnamese sandwich) with us, we followed the call. The bumpy dirt road lead us to a very nice beach: the Cua Can Beach. It was almost empty. Only some locals were there.
Feet in the sand, sun on the skin and Bunh Mí in the hand.

As there were some swings (so amazing), we could not withstand to release our inner child.

data.formatted_address: Mussel Beach grooves, Phu Quoc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Mussel Beach grooves

reviews.text:
I love this area of Phu Quoc island a lot since you have to drive through the national park then got to the white sand beach which is full of starfishes.
Recently they starts to make it more touristic and have some restaurants on the beach. The food is good, many different seafoods but its a bit expensive.
Do:
- Drive motorbike here, you can go to the floating house villages first to see local people’s life, then go to the beach for swimming and having lunch
- Starfish season is from Nov - March
- Good to spend all day here
- Order the Cobia hot pot (~500k-600k/2 people, 1kg of Cobia) because the price of shrimp or crabs etc here is quite expensive

This beach is very difficult to access (see photo for road condition) and has nothing to offer. The shore was full of trash and even had syringes mixed in the sand. It’s not only unhygienic but very unsafe to walk here.
This is a hidden gem and not to be missed. Starfish are plenty at the beach & provides good Instagram opportunities. Reasonable seafood can be found here too.
The beach is famous for the starfish. The view is nice, just a bit difficult to go.
Almost perfect, but even in this paradise starfish and plastic soaking together in the crisp clear ocean. So said 😤

data.formatted_address: Bà Kèo, Tp. Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Bà Kèo

reviews.text: It’s one of the better beaches in PQ especially the southern side of this beach. Like many said, the northern side or mid-area ain’t that great honestly though.
Very nice beach which is clean, and not closed off by resorts👍👍

I am sure it's nicer during high season but when we visited in September 2023 it wasn't great. Sewage & rubbish everywhere. No sun Loungers or beach bars to relax on.

We decided to go to Khem beach instead which has to be the best beach on the island, so much nicer.

The beach has some good restaurants, beach bars and quite nice sections, but seems like those are only kept clean by the respective resorts and bars. Partly questionable to disgusting sewage that flows into the sea.
During our stay, the water was never really clear, always somewhat cloudy and greenish. Depending on the current, a lot of garbage was washed up (small plastic particles, styrofoam, fresh+sticky food packaging and large plastic sheets).
The beach itself is beautiful, but overall kind of sad when you take a closer look and see the extent of littering.

Excellent clean beach on the west coast of the island. If the wind and tide is blowing trash on the east beaches (which it was during our time in Phu Quoc) come here as it was spotless. Loads of great relaxing beach bars and some great prices restaurants too.

data.formatted_address: 8RQX+6C8, Ganh Dau, Phú Quốc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Bai Dai beach

reviews.text:
One of the best spots to chilling under sunset in Vietnam with kayaking, swimming, or just lying on the beach and drinking cocktail.
You can rent sup, canoe or kayak just on the beach with affordable price.
White and soft sand, flat.
Recommend to visit from Oct to April, best would be from Nov to March (other months might rain or too hot).

However, beach becomes dark and quite after 6:30 and there might have mosquitoes. Make sure that you have an-ti mosquitos if you wanna stay longer

One of the Most beautifull beach i have ever seen! Its a shame that it s quite hard to access now that you need to go through all these securities from Vin pearl resort or take the long way around the resort (which lies along the beach and cover up its most beautiful part for  itself ).
Wow! Very wonderfull! The long beach with smooth sand! Water sea is very clear and blue! Welcome all of you! My farmily love this beach!
Cleaniness beach but you can't go to here if you don't stay in Vinpearl hotel. It belongs to them now. The long beach now isn't public anymore.
Taken over by resorts like so many places here. Only part you can access via a dirt track after all the hotels is filled with rubbish. Don't waste your time

Don't visit this place! Seriously!
They collect the starfishes an THROUGH them closer to the beach so that the tourists can see them better. Many of the starfishes were already dead.
They will continue until all the starfishes are dead.

Please don’t go this place, it is waste of time and energy we had a flight ay 2pm we came here at 8 am and local scams you with another location and star fishes are not naturally their but caught in the net and bought there very inhumane and disgusting please dont go very much garbage on beach nothing like wasting your time here, if you are backpacker don’t go

No starfish. Terrible road in.

data.formatted_address: To 3, Ông Lang, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Ancarine Beach Resort

reviews.text:
This place was so tranquil. Our room (beach bungalow) was spacious, clean and well equipped. The AC was a dream!
All the staff were super friendly and really wanted you to enjoy your holiday.
The gardens are beautiful, as is the pool and the beach.

After spending 2 weeks cycling in Vietnam I was looking for somewhere peaceful to relax. The Ancarine was perfect for this. The location is great with its own spotless, quiet beach. The resort is well maintained with lovely gardens and facilities. Rooms are large, very clean and quiet. The breakfast is excellent with lots of fresh fruit and a choice of European or local food. On my final morning staff even kindly made me a takeaway breakfast as I had an early flight. There are bikes you can borrow free of charge to explore on and there are a choice of local cafes, restaurants and shops within 15 mins walk or a 5 min bike ride. The staff are very friendly and I would highly recommend!

We stayed here for 5 days. The hotel is in a very peaceful location and only a short walk/cycle from the shops/restaraunts/bars if you need a change. The staff were amazing, especially Hien and Dat. They made our stay perfect. The food in the restaraunt was great quality and the bar well stocked. The room was cost and the AC worked perfectly. Will definitely visit again in the future.

Our stay in Acarine was an absolute highlight of the trip. We had spacious and comfortable room with the terrace, everything was perfect. Delicious breakfast with fresh food and good choices. Small, but clean and neat beach. Very quiet and relaxing place.
Local village with restaurants, bars, laundry service and spa is about 10 mins walk away (all of those services available at the hotel too).

Suggestion for improvement: as a non smoking guest, I wish that smoking would be forbidden in common areas.

I've stayed here nearly a week in May.
Everything was excellent from check in to check out. Staffs always with a smile, room was great, AC great, massages were amazing as well as the restaurant food. I will definitely recommend and come back. Thank you team for the memorable stay

data.formatted_address: 82JJ+M57, Phu Quoc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Phu Quoc National Park

reviews.text: This national park is difficult to access as roads are dreadful and some parts are at times used by the army. Therefore you'd best go with a local guide who can tell you about the local flora and fauna, who can advice you in the unfortunate event of snake or insect bite and who can make sure you see the best parts.

The park is closed and access is denied. There are several military checkpoints, no one could explain what is the exact reason for it. Further on the same road there is a restaurant with a wooden bridge where you could overcome the checkpoints, but I read many tourists got scammed and were forced to pay to cross it. Please don’t fall for it! I see many locals were able to hike in the park, so I am sure there is an alternative way in.
No entrance, guard yelled at me "NO" and made a go away gesture. Can't recommend trying.

For those who are confused… yes there is a military presence at the park. They are here to help protect the national park from poachers, with conservation, and to keep fires under control. I think you just need to know where you are allowed before you wander in.

There was no tour online but our resort knew who to call and we were pointed to a restaurant where the tour guide works. We booked out one day.

As for the park, it was quite beautiful. The perfect place to visit if you are interested in trees, flowers and plants. I went in the dry season and we saw lizards and a snake. I think others have seen monkeys though.
Nothing in North of Phu quoc.    Very country side and not easy to find restaurants.    But some of quite hotel and stay rooms in there.  Too far from downtown...

data.formatted_address: 40 Đường Nguyễn Trãi, Khu 1, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Cao Dai Temple of Phu-Quoc

reviews.text: Very nice temple, has couple floors with very tiny stairs. The decoration was amazing and the people were very friendly. The only bad thing is that when you enter it feels like you are going through someones living room.

It is a temple of Cao Dai religion.
The temple is good looking from the outside, but nearly empty inside. Cannot compare to the Tay Ninh Cao Dai temple.
Vao Dai is a kind of  mixture of buddhism, catholic, taoism, confucianism etc., which is originated from Tay Ninh, near Saigon.
We walked by here when visiting the night market, impressed by the two-tower architecture and heavily coloured in a Vietnamese tone.
Dunno why this is #1 on tripadvisor. There was one better (a lot) 300m to the west (beach). This one was half stuck onto somebodys house.
Nice place. Very colourfull  church and friendly ppl

data.formatted_address: Town, Bai Khem, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 920000, Vietnam
data.name: Premier Residences Phu Quoc Emerald Bay Managed by Accor

reviews.text:
• Very nice resort, all rooms have balcony, clean and modern. I stayed in Family 2 bedrooms with ocean view. This suite is big, comfortable and beautiful view.
• Great value for money. The rate of this hotel is very reasonable and not expensive at all.
• The swimming pool is huge and long
• Beautiful and clean private beach at Bai Khem.
• Friendly and helpful staff.
• Breakfast buffet is really good, variety of dishes, many choices of tea, coffee, juice. Breakfast is better than other 5 stars hotels, resorts in VN that I have stayed before.

We really enjoyed our holiday in this resort.
Highly recommended 👍

The staff were all exceptional, but An was still a stand out. We enjoyed the hotel amenities (one of the best in-hotel gyms we've seen). The free shuttle to and from Sunset Town was a great bonus (big white 45-seater bus), but we didn't get the free show tickets as a few days of mourning were declared when we arrived. Some of the prices were a bit high for our budget, but there was a small supermarket, and a few food choices just across the street which suited us perfectly.

Be aware this hotel definitely fake reviews to boost its scores on google.
The hotel is nicely located with easy access to the shuttle to go to Sunset town and the cable car. The hotel is nicely family oriented with lots of little kids running around and the family vacationing. But sadly, I have to say this is the worst accord managed hotel I have ever stayed that. there is a pungent moly smell in every room we looked. The room was extremely badly managed with a lot of damage, not fixed. They only provide one kind of shampoo and body wash two in one, no air conditioner. Also, the hotel hire people to leave good reviews.  Also the hotel charges delivery fee for simple thing as ice. The breakfast was crowded, but the variety are decent. The hotel gave us free tickets to kiss of the sea show which is nice surprise. But still overall this is not a hotel I would pick if I am here for a romantic getaway. This is a hotel suitable for family with small children who doesn’t mind a crowded moldy hotel.

This is now arguably the best beach to be on this side of the island during the rainy season (dry season is on the other side of the island). No garbage, the hotel has kayak and SUP to use for free. Loads of restaurant options along the beach. It's 10min car ride to the cable car and not far from the airport. The service is really good and you really don't need to leave the hotel as it has this gigantic pool, with a clean beach, and restaurants nearby (including the ones inside other hotels). A perfect family vacation hotel and the breakfast was amazing!

The staff have been so lovely and helpful throughout our entire stay. The facilities are great! The pool is fantastic,  the beach is beautiful and the breakfast is amazing. A must is to go to Sunset town to watch the light show which we had for free because we were staying at emerald. There is a shuttle through the hotel that runs every 30 min to sunset town which makes the commute easy. Highly recommend!

data.formatted_address: Khem Beach, An Thới, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 922280, Vietnam
data.name: JW Marriott Phu Quoc Emerald Bay Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Where do I start! This resort is absolutely fabulous in ever way. We stayed for four nights and enjoyed every second. The buildings are stunning along with all the interior. The food and drinks were fantastic and the staff were super polite and attentive. The pool is just steps away from the beach. I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for a relaxing holiday away from the hustle and bustle of Vietnam! I will be back!

Wow! Where to start?! This is not just a hotel - it’s an experience. From the mind blowing architecture and interior design to the impeccable food to the heartwarming staff, this has got to be the most outstanding hotel I’ve ever stayed at. The whole hotel is incredibly detail oriented and I’ve never seen anything like it. It’s been an amazing experience and we’ll be back. Just amazing.

This resort deserves praise not merely because the staff are friendly, the beach is beautiful, and the buildings are attractive.

It perfectly revives Lamarck University, allowing guests to experience life as students through various activities offered by the resort.

As a huge fan of Bill Bensley, I was never disappointed during my 4-night, 5-day stay. The resort staff ensured that every aspect of my experience was delightful.

Having experienced many good hotels and resorts, I can say that the hospitality here is among the best. This is a fantastic destination that I would love to return to in the future. See you again!

It was a profound experience I've had since my first birthday party.
I'd like to give you 10 points for Marriott evaluation as well, but the review link has expired, so I'm writing it here.
- The check-in was delayed by 1 hour, but the upgrade led to sun pool and veranda, and I was assigned a first floor room with an ocean view in front of me, which was the most important advantage of the accommodation experience, and it was well worth the wait.
If I visit again with my family next month, I would want to be assigned to that location again
- Various activities were provided free of charge, and there was no need to walk to this activity.
- All facilities were private by reservation. From movie theaters to saunas...
- When he said it was his birthday, he prepared handwriting and cake, and after working out, he also brought mangoes.
- The moment I went out to various activities, the staff cleaned up the room and the amenities. In conclusion, the accommodation was always kept clean

We celebrated our wedding anniversary at the JW Marriott PQ. Elegant, quirky and fun is the least one could say about the property. The themed buildings, the landscapes and staff make this one of the best hotels on the island to visit.
Food across their multiple restaurants was adequate in the range of cuisines.

The loud speaking of families and screaming kids takes away from the charm somewhat for the travellers looking for calm and quiet.

One of the best properties we've had the pleasure of visiting and would always recommend

data.formatted_address: Bai Dai Area, Cửa Cạn - Gành Dầu, Gành Dầu, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Meliá Vinpearl Phu Quoc

reviews.text: The resort is very beautiful and cool with many trees around.  Villa is clean, nice view, each villa has its own pool if you want privacy. Breakfast is very delicious and the service staff is very enthusiastic.Anna was so friendly and helpful.  True to five-star resort standards. The paths are spacious so the buggy can move. The main swimming pool is clean.All in all, It was such an interesting trip to me.

The location and facility is beautiful, the food is excellent especially the breakfast buffet. Very convenient to get around the island with electric cars taking you around.

However there is a huge plumbing issue as in 3 days of my stay, twice the toilet flooded. The laundry service was the worst; I clearly marked and communicated I needed the clothes to be washed, they were clearly dirty but I was returned them dirty and just steam pressed

It was my first family trip in 4 years so choosing an accommodation was very difficult and cautious for me. The moment I arrived here, the friendly staff, comfortable space, delicious food, it was so perfect, it was like a dream.The staff is super friendly and helpful. A shout out to a lady Ms. Anna who has been extremely helpful to us when we visited. She also recommended us to places in Phu Quoc that were nice and special. The hotel room is comfortable and clean. Travelers who are reading this and considering accommodation. If you have this, you can choose this place without considering it. By choosing this place, you will experience the best

Great place for a memorable getaway!
The hotel is located in a convenient spot, it also offers a shuttle ride to/from the airport. The staff is extremely friendly, kind and respectful, during our stay they went above and beyond to make us feel at home. We enjoyed their breakfast buffet options. We want to give a special shout out to Lavie, she was our amazing concierge, she was available all the time and made our stay an even more pleasant experience! Thank you Lavie!! And thank you to all staff members providing such outstanding service, we can’t way to come back!

jonath. As soon as the vehicle arrived, I received the carrier and moved it, and I couldn't understand the lack of English communication, so I turned on the translator, explained it right away, and took a picture. The tension disappeared from the children's smile and kindness. The staff were very kind and Jonas worked even harder. Thank you.

data.formatted_address: 01 Đường Võ Thị Sáu, TT. Dương Đông, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 92500, Vietnam
data.name: Seashells Phu Quoc Hotel & Spa

reviews.text:
Still confused about the bad reviews. After reading it’s reviews I have been hesitant if I should book or not in the end, my friends decided to stay for 2 nights and it’s our biggest regret. We should have stayed longer. First of all, Seashells is not a RESORT! So expect that it’s more fast paced and busier than big resorts.
But given it’s location it’s purely understandable. The front desk is always busy but the staff are very efficient and welcoming. The breakfast very good and menu for lunch & dinner reasonably priced. the facilities! Pool & beach on city center is A GEM!!! The room could use revamping with design but comfortable and functional. Overall it was great! But like I said, if you want a slow paced BIG RESORTS then find somewhere else.

Our second time here and will be back next year. The staff are fantastic throughout the hotel. The breakfast is very comprehensive and well thought out . Dining ,lunch or dinner has a great selection and well prepared. We chose an Ocean view room over the pool(would recommend), rooms are spacious, clean and quiet.  Pool and beach are clean and well looked after by the staff. The location is excellent as it is a few minutes walk to the Duong Dong night markets. Highly recommend this hotel.

My partner and I stayed at Seashells for 2 nights and the stay was incredible! We were so accommodated by all staff and the extra touches like fruit delivery in our room and complimentary spa voucher with booking really made the stay. I’d love to have something negative to say about the stay but it was honestly one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had!

Will be sure to return/recommend for anyone staying in Phu Quoc

this hotel is highly recommended to family and couples. we bought with free spa offer with two bedroom suite (balcony included). it was such a great deal with 60 mins spa for the four of us (highly recommended to book in advance, i asked in email before arrival, they told me i can book on the spot, but when we arrived, they told me it was full for the day. Luckily they did their best to arrange for us in the end.) you can also enjoy sunset at their infinity pool and private beach. great view and atmosphere! its in the city, a lot of food just outside the hotel.

Seashells was perfect after a month of touring around Vietnam.  Staff were very helpful,  room had a magnificent view of the sea and the temple to the side. The food in the restaurant was delicious and we especially enjoyed the buffets. Staff couldn't be more helpful.
Spent alot of time at the pool relaxing.... perfection

data.formatted_address: 100c/14 Đường Trần Hưng Đạo TT. Dương Đông Phu Quoc, 100c/14 Đường Trần Hưng Đạo, TT. Dương Đông, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 92000, Vietnam
data.name: Thanh Kieu Beach Resort

reviews.text:
The resort was good with the prices they offered. The rooms were well maintained & clean. But still coming to the service not so satisfied as we had an issue with the A/c.
The restaurant inside the resort is expensive compared to the shacks just outside which is at a walkable distance which have good food drinks & other entertainment shows.
Even though we had some difficulties with the language the staff were so helping & supporting.
The complimentary breakfast didn’t have so much choices but still all the food they provided were good.
After all we had  a good time except the issue regarding A/c.

Awful breakfast ! Deteriorate milk and low quality food.
Terrible rooms - when raining , brown water running down the walls.
Hefty mosquito plague!
Overall impression, resort looks very shabby and need a complete renovation.
Pool area and beach are nice .

Location was great, many good restaurants and shops etc. nearby. You can also rent a scooter from the resort. Also the resort's own restaurant served good local food. Room was nice and cozy. Staff were very helpful. Plenty to choose from at breakfast. Good value for money.

This is a very good place to stay if you like
- private beach with lots of chairs for you to rest.
- in-house restaurant that is vegetarian friendly and provides tasty food.
- friendly staffs
- eco friendly resort (they don’t provide  plastic bottled water in the room)
- clean place to stay

We spent 4 nights at Thanh Kieu and fell in love with this serene place! The beach is well maintained with good sun beads and lots of shadow. The area does not feel crowded and the the garden is beautifully taken care of. Biggest plus is by far the outdoor showers in the bungalows and the amazing pool with it's perfect view over palm trees and the ocean. Minus were the old mosquito net which had holes in them (and old blood...) so we were eaten up the first night before it was changed for a better one (not new). The doors to veranda do not close completely which meant more mosquitos.

data.formatted_address: Tổ 5, ấp, Suối Mây, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 92509, Vietnam
data.name: Suoi May Garden Resort & Spa

reviews.text:
👎Bad experience:
First Rude recepcionist, not welcoming, don't understand an international language.

Impossible to sleep, bad building that retain heat without insulation so inside it's a sauna.

Bad smell inside the room. Dust, not deeply cleaned.

The maids entered the room while I was still sleeping and ruined my sleep, there is no sign to put on the door to not be disturbed.

Lack of privacy as the windows are all by the side where everyone is walking by.

- Clean and spacious room, good value.
- The pool is great, the facilities in the room are useful- kettle, fridge, hair dryer etc.
- Kind and helpful staff
- Breakfast is good
- The location is quiet, however if you want to go around the island, you need a taxi/Grab, Rent a motorbike

- Clean and spacious room
- Nice and clean swimming pool
- kind and helpfull staff (note, most of the communication went through Google Translate and pictures)

- we were very disappointed in the breakfast. It was advertised as a switching continental, a la carte and English breakfast. However it was the same every day (Vietnamese noodle soup, rice broth and/or Fried rice). We noted this to the staff and the hotline, the later was very rude and didn't show any understanding for our disappointment regarding this false advertisement.

- the location is quiet, however if you want to go around the island, you need a taxi/Grab, Rent a motorbike, or walk at least 2km to the nearest busstop (free shuttle vinbusses)

This place has got to be the best value hotel I have stayed at in my life. for around $7 per night (twin room) you get a fantastic infinity swimming pool with jacuzzi and a nicely designed garden with some beautiful plants/ trees; spacious and well furnished rooms are cleaned well every day and have rather comfy beds. the bathroom/ toilet/ shower are all nice and clean with a nice modern flourish, only minor fault was some slight inconsistent water temp and pressure. The staff are friendly and sorted motorbike rental for us at a decent price. not really a bad word to say about this place as it is a very peaceful place to stay at just a ridiculously good price for what you get.

Very clean room, good value.

Comfortable beds, ergonomic pillows for your neck, and spacious.

The pool is great, the facilities in the room are useful- kettle, fridge, hair dryer etc.

Nice bathroom, hot and cold water, soap and shower gel included.

There is even a porch area to keep drying clothes and dirty shoes.

The owners were extremely kind and sorted out motorbikes for us to rent. The bikes were in excellent condition and had no faults over the two days we used them.

data.formatted_address: Tổ 5 Đường Dinh Bà, Ông Lang, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Emerald Garden Retreat Ong Lang beach

reviews.text: I totally loved the place. Had such a really good time counting on that I had to spend most of my time in there because of the storm that took place during my holiday. Beds are huge aswell as the bathroom. Loved the swimming pool. We could rent a bike just in the same resort that was very helpful. Don’t know how his name is written but the guy that host us was so kind and nice I won’t ever forget.

Best place on the island, the team is so nice, the pool and rooms are perfect. The beach in front of ocean bay is open to everyone and really clean. We spend a really good time there. And it’s far from the concrete area that goes on, everywhere in the island.

Beautiful resort located in a beautiful garden. Rooms are spacious and clean, pool is great.
Guests have free laundry and kitchen availble here. Stuff is nice. Hope to go back once again.
In a walking distance from hotel is small shop and few restaurants and ATM. Also the beach.

Amazing place and staff! We will return for sure

The hotel is very well situated, close to the beach and close to nice restaurants.
The room was very well equipped, nicely decorated, very clean, towels and bathrobes were changed daily.
The staff is very nice, they were very useful, helped us to rent a motorbike, and they recommended us very nice places to visit and activities in Phu Quac.
Nice pool and surroundings (nature').
A little extra point for the washing machine and dryer which is free for the guests to use on their own.
This place is very nice, comfortable and cozy, suitable for couples, family or group of friends. The staffs are very friendly and supportive. A nice place to enjoy your getaway trip.

data.formatted_address: Đường Lê Thúc Nha tổ 3, Ông Lang, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 920000, Vietnam
data.name: Tropical Garden Homestay

reviews.text: This is our second time here and we just had another lunch, very tasty. Spring rolls with prawns are delicious and Pho Bo is also very nice. Big bowl and tasty. Passion fruit juice nice and sour, perfect for the hot day!Lady serving us really friendly. Place looks lovely and very clean.

Excellent food, at a reasonable price. My wife and I have been eating here the last couple of years and it's a little gem!!! Staff so friendly and the fried spring rolls are to absolutely die for.  Come here and you certainly won't be disappointed. We love it and will be back!!!
Very small portions, I had beef with vegetables and rice, It was like three spoon of rice. I am woman, It was not enough for me. Taste was good.
We ate at the restaurant almost everyday of our trip. Much better than the other restaurants around it. Staff very friendly!
They have rooms which we were not staying in so this review is about the restaurant. See below. Superb! 5 star food and service.

data.formatted_address: 7W6V+W27, Cửa Dương, Phú Quốc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Spring Garden Homestay

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay here last year. Spacious rooms, if you have a scooter it’s the perfect stay.

We really enjoyed our stay here! The place was quiet and close to a super amazing restaurant called May Jo's Fusion treat, some of the most amazing food we've had in Vietnam! The gardens here are beautiful, perfect to spend the evening under the stars listening to the cicadas and the frogs. There are many beautifully flowering trees in the garden. The bed was comfortable. The staff here it was willing to help us with everything as soon as an issue arose. It was great!

Hosts are so friendly and will get you anything you need. Walking distance to beach, restaurants, bike rental.  We brought a bottle of wine back one night then realized we didn't have any way to open it, the host brought us an opener and lovely wine glasses. Really cute. We will definitely be back.

Great location, few minutes walking from the beach and right next to a street full of restaurants. The room is really cleaned and the hosts are awesome, as well as the delicious breakfast they prepare fresh every morning.
It is close to the best beach on the island, the place, the garden, the bungalows are beautiful and the owner helps you in everything to make your stay a happy one. Highly recommend.

data.formatted_address: Đường Trần Hưng Đạo, Street, Beach, Kiên Giang 095000, Vietnam
data.name: La Veranda Resort Phu Quoc - MGallery

reviews.text: We loved everything about La Veranda. The staff were friendly and helpful and gave us a lovely welcome and goodbye. The food was excellent, with plenty of choice for breakfast. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and we had a wonderful balcony with a sea view. The private beach was clean and comfortable and the gardens were beautiful! I loved the little complementary extra touches such as the sorbet on the beach, the back massage, the afternoon tea and the nightly plate of sweetmeats. We had a very relaxing stay here and were sorry to leave.

Four nights in March, and we had a lovely stay. Everyone from Front Desk, over Housekeeping, to staff by the beach or the pool were friendly, helpful and welcoming.
The hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The room was spacious and quiet. The food was excellent.
The beach front was, on the whole, slightly underwhelming, and the sand bags did nothing to enhance the charm, but this was a minor gripe.
Tip: Don't book tours through the hotel, as it wasn't worth the money.

I loved this hotel so much that we extended our 3 days to 10 days.
I loved the character of the Fench Colonial buildings set amongst the lush tropical gardens, the picturesque beach and the beautiful pool.
We made some friends during the complimentary afternoon tea and spent several afternoons all hanging out on the verandah.
I recommended attending the free yoga classes in the morning too.
I hope to come back in the future.

My third stay here in La Veranda and again fantastic. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. We were upgraded to a garden villa and had two connecting rooms.
The tropical garden is green, lush and gives lots of privacy in the private garden of the room. Breakfast is amazing, lots of choice and staff friendly.
Overall all the staff is friendly. Pretty much every evening the hotel organises an activity for their guests. Well recommended!!!

I had the most amazing time at this beautiful resort and have already recommended it to my family and friends. Wonderful rooms, facilties and staff. The best holiday I have ever been on! Thank you for making my stay so enjoyable. Also a special shout out to Sam for being so friendly and professional!

data.formatted_address: 2266+QVC, An Thoi, Phú Quốc, Kien Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Hải đăng An Thới

reviews.text:
Unfortunately, we were unable to ride the cable car. I have a thing with heights .
But we did have a lovely afternoon swimming in the warm blue sea and drying off in sunshine .
The Mediterranean look-alike village  takes a lot of getting used to not sure about it really.
.
Beautiful cable car, went in December and all the colourful boats plus the beautiful town view. I also liked the attractions across the sea, I enjoyed the water park.

A huge waste of money.
The cable takes you to the water park and nothing more. If you don't go for the park don't do it.
The beach is very small and dirty and you can't reach the other parts of the island from here.
We saw many people who didn't realize it was a cable for a water park only.

The views are awesome and it's a great experience

BUT be aware that if you start your trip shortly before the next break in operating hours, you'll be stuck in the car for up to 90 minutes..
Temporary close (or permanent?), nothing to do here and no information support for this place.

data.formatted_address: KP9, TT. Dương Đông, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: The Shells Resort and Spa Phu Quoc

reviews.text: Room was spacious and impeccably clean, offering stunning ocean views that I could wake up to every morning. The private balcony was the perfect spot to enjoy a cup of coffee and watch the sunrise paint the sky with vibrant colors. The bathtub is a amazing to be put in the middle of the room. The resort's private beach was a dream come true. The soft sand was perfect for long walks, and the calm waters were ideal for swimming and relaxing. The staff provided comfortable sun loungers and umbrellas, ensuring a truly luxurious beach experience.

Room is not clean, water stains are all over the bath tub, so we did not use it.
Water pressure is unstable, keep changing between low flow and high flow. Even the toilet cannot be flushed every time after we used.
Location is not convenient, it takes around 15 mins to go from hotel to night market, (which also increase a large amount of transport fee) and extra 10-15 mins to wait for hotel to send a golf cart for picking up to the lobby. We have waited for 30 mins to get to the lobby for once. There is nothing around hotel, so if you need things, you better buy it before going back to hotel.
Facilities are not sufficient and seems old. And many staffs don’t speak English, has many misunderstanding in communication.

Like it a lot.
The view in the hotel and from the room is amazing!
Staff are really welcoming and nice.
Front desk girl Hong is always with a big smile on her face. She speaks Chinese to me making me feel like at home.
The resort is big so you need a golf cart to move around, Minh is such a skilled driver always driving you to the very front of the door to the lobby.
Also thanks to Vu and Phuc for the free transportation to the airport.
It was a lovely stay, would like to recommend to everyone.

The massive positives of this place are the private beach and the rooms. Sunset views are hard to beat here. Breakfast overlooking the sea will also be hard to beat in Phu Quoc.

Food at the hotel restaurant is high quality so a little expensive as you would expect.

There wasnt a bar area open in the evenings so atmosphere when we were there was a little quiet, but maybe not the case at other times of the year.

Massage from the spa was incredible, would reccomend this to anyone staying.

Whilst it does need sole modernisation around the edges, the resort overall does have a luxurious feeling.

It is a 15 minute drive to town centre so it does feel secluded. However, the hotel make it easy to arrange taxis for convenience.

The Good: Great view from the balcony overlooking the ocean and pool, comfortable bed, friendly staff, good complimentary breakfast, quiet resort, 15-20 minute drive to street market and shops

The Bad: Where do I begin....? 10 or 15 years ago this place might have been 5 stars, but today it's completely worn down, in dire need of a severe makeover, 2 stars at best for the price they charge.... Trash on the beach and in the water makes swimming in the ocean done at your own risk. Friendly staff, but incompetent management. What management team schedules pool maintenance for the weekend, as opposed to the weekday, when they're most likely not so busy?

data.formatted_address: Tổ 3, Ông Lang, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 922200, Vietnam
data.name: Phu Quoc Eco Beach Resort

reviews.text:
This is a very nice cute little resort. We had a very good time here and the staff are friendly and served you well. They have a small private beach that’s protected from the waves.   The pool area is clean and it has a nice view of the ocean and beach. The breakfast has plenty of variety.

A few recommendations I have for the resort would be :

To change the sheets on the bed more frequently

The fitness room needs to be updated as all the equipment is Rusty

The pool table is also slanted and has holes and in the pockets, and the pool cues are all broken were warped.

Around the front of the restaurant area it is very slippery and needs to be cleaned as lots of moss has grown.

They need to be a little more helpful in terms of things to do in the area.

There were lots of ants in the bathroom. And there is also a nest of some kind of insect underneath the bathroom sink.

Fantastic place to stay away from the newly created tourist area. Fantastic food and service. Great beach for swimming and the pool is fantastic. Rooms have air-conditioning and beds are comfy. Don't get your laundry done here however it's way to expensive. Find a local place who charges per kg. We will be back!

This place was amazing even though it was raining most of the time. The view of the beach and ocean was spectacular and the looked great. Breakfast at the main lobby was really good and you could choose from a huge variety of different foods.

What a great hotel to stay in Phu Quoc. The room is quite big and clean. The bed is a bit too hard tough. The AC works very well. The staff is very friendly, from the reception to the restaurant. Me and my girlfriend were a bit sick while there and the staff always adjusted our meals, including the breakfast to something a bit lighter. Anna (probably not writing the name correctly) was a 5 stars :) she always prepared us some nice ginger teas with honey, she gave us some ginger for us to eat during the day, she prepared me a great and diet breakfast. It felt like I was home.
Highly recommend.

The room was spacious with good air conditioning. Daily service was great. The bathroom is great with a great shower stream with nice pressure, a little bit outdated but still great.

The mattress is on the hard side but was comfortable. Pillow (4) in the room are just a regular pillows

The hotel staff is courteous and friendly.
Special thank you to the front desk: very knowledgeable and super accommodating, always planning ahead. You can order a taxi, a car with a driver, or a moto scooter. Excursions as well.

Free breakfast is sufficient and tasty

The restaurant is good. Food is tailored to Europeans with local specifics. The restaurant staff is friendly and the service is fast. They were able to accommodate a group of 10 easily.

data.formatted_address: 8VH7+5GR, ĐT45, Gành Dầu, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang 920000, Vietnam
data.name: Tinh Hoa Vietnam Quintessence of Vietnam

reviews.text: Really good place made with big attention to details. We’re happy to see all these incredible national houses, historic crafts, cultural elements, national decorative elements, people in national costumes. We were searching for place like this one. You can do lotof photos and have really good experience with getting known Vietnamese culture.
Nice to watch and new experience. You can buy ticket from klook or go to the ticket counter located at the water taxi.

Glad to see that Vietnamese historical performace is being improved a lot these days.
Compared to other historical shows in other countries, of course, there must be some room to elevate the show.

Recommend if you are around here and not found things to entertain your family.

Nearby, there’s also the Tinh Hoa Viet Nam show (aka Quintessence of Vietnam) which we originally thought of watching. However, we eventually chose not to because of the 300k VND entry price for a show depicted in Vietnamese – didn’t think of paying for a show that we didn’t understand.

For more details, visit 2bearbear today!

I'll lay it out here now why there are still negative reviews about the show. Unfortunately for our foreign friends, it requires some understanding of Vietnamese mythology, culture and history to be able to fully enjoy the show. The acts are based around folk stories, historical cultures and events, and to a foreign viewer it might look like just a few unrelated dance performances.

I hope in the future they could post some explanations about the stories being told through the performance (eg the creation myth of Vietnam, Dong Son culture etc). Once you actually understand it, it's truly amazing.

data.formatted_address: 8VH7+743, ĐT45, Gành Dầu, Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang, Vietnam
data.name: Huyền Thoại Tre

reviews.text: Bamboo Building (also known as Bamboo Legend) that is built entirely out of bamboo. What we love about it is not only because of the use of bamboo as a more sustainable material for building construction, the entire structure is so symmetrical and beautiful both on the outside and the inside.

I was mesmerized by this gorgeous bamboo building and the architect who made such a masterpiece. As I understood, this is more like the abstract freehand shape of a lotus flower which has a deep purpose and value in Vietnamese culture. It also represents the harmonious coexistence of man and nature. Creative and absolutely stunning.
It is a wonderful place both during the day and at night. It will be commemorated as a symbol of Vietnam. Various performances are held at night.
Lovely garden with artistic figurines , statues . So charming and lovely place to stroll by at grand world located at north of Phu Quốc near Vinpearl
Amazing Architecture, go there now!! Near it there is an amazing performance at night!! Worth the money
